properties.synopsis: Victim committed suicide by pouring gasoline on himself and lighting himself on fire. As a result, the house near the victim caught fire.

Officers responded to a "415 party" involving minors consuming alcohol. Officers located two minors in critical condition due to alcohol intoxication. The minors were subsequently transported to the hospital and listed in stable condition. The owner of the residence was arrested for contributing to the delinquency of a minor.
Suspect was arrested for kicking the victim in the head and stomach. Victim was admitted to a hospital in stable condition.
Suspects, one-five, approached victim and a fight ensued. Suspects, one-five, repeatedly hit and kicked the victim causing injury.

The victim was walking home with a female when four male Hispanics approached him. The suspects asked the victim where he was from and the victim responded he was with his family.  The suspects told the victim they did not care and struck him on the head twice with a baseball bat causing him to fall to the ground.  Once on the ground all the suspects began kicking the victim. The victim was treated at a local hospital for a four-inch cut to his head and numerous bruises.
properties.address: San Fernando Road and Polk Street
properties.injuries: Cut to the head and bruises

properties.synopsis: On Oct. 20, 2008 at 2:50 a.m., the victim who is the manager of a CVS Pharmacy was beaten by drunken suspects when he attempted to kick them out of the store. The victim was transported to Northridge Hospital for treatment. Officers were advised that the victim had been admitted to the hospital due of the severity of his injuries.

The victims were standing in front of Ralph's market when two cars containing approximately eight males threatened them with baseball bats.  As the suspects committed their assault, a victim drew a shank. No one was struck by the baseball bats. The suspects entered their vehicles and fled prior to the police arrival. The victim threw down a shank when the officers approached him. He was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon.

Officers responded to Holy Cross Medical Center where they talked with the victim who had a cut to his neck. Victim said he was at a party near the location. Victim said he was attacked by three to five suspects. Victim said one suspect hit him in the head with a bottle but didn't know how he got the cut to his neck. A follow-up to the location revealed no party or fight.

Suspect was on a horse and trampled a three-year-old. Witnesses attempted to detain suspect who fled on foot through the park. Two witnesses had observed the suspect riding a white horse and drinking an alcoholic beverage. Suspect was arrested on an outstanding warrant.
Victim pointed out suspect to officers who responded to a call. Suspect had attacked victim with a crow bar and smashed victim's vehicle windshield. Suspect was arrested.
Three victims were walking down the street when suspects began yelling at them. One suspect fired four rounds and hit one victim in the thigh.
Victim was standing in the driveway of his apartment when he was approached by two males. The suspects struck the victim in the head with a bottle causing a large cut. Suspects fled.

properties.crime: Assault with a deadly weapon-hate crime
properties.synopsis: Male Hispanics confronted a male Black business owner with racial slurs and displayed a handgun. Officers responded to a similar call at 8:23 p.m. in Devonshire Division, identified the suspects and arrested them.

properties.crime: Assault with a deadly weapon-hate crime arrest
properties.synopsis: Victim was walking to his residence from a liquor store. As he neared an alley, he heard someone from a group of gang members yell a racial obscenity toward him. Victim returned to the liquor store and called a friend for a ride. After being dropped off at his apartment building, the victim was confronted by one of the gang members who was holding a pistol. The victim recognized the suspect as living in his apartment complex. Suspect was arrested.

Suspect smashed a rear window to gain entry to a residence. Suspect ransacked several bedrooms. Victim confronted suspect with, "What are you doing here? Get out!" Suspect pointed pistol at victim but then fled through the smashed window. Victim observed suspect running westbound on Weddington Street toward Encino Avenue.

Suspect climbed over a fence and entered the rear yard of a residence. Suspect turned off all the power circuit breakers and went to a window. The victim woke up to noises outside and observed the suspect in the backyard. The suspect saw the victim and fled.

While the victim was in the shower, the victim heard someone open and close the front door. He later discovered that someone had pried his front door open to get in. The suspect took off without taking any property.

The victim was inside the back bedroom of his apartment complex when he observed the door open and the suspect standing in the doorway. The suspect was described as a male black wearing a sock on his hand. The suspect took off without taking any property.

The suspect entered via an unlocked rear door. Then the suspect went into the rear bedroom as dogs began to bark. The suspect took off when confronted by the victim.  No property was taken. The suspect is described as a male Hispanic, with a shaved head, 5 foot 8, 180, 20 to 30-years-old, wearing a white T-shirt, blue jeans and possible tattoos on his arms.
Two suspects attempted to enter a house but were frightened off by the residents. Responding officers set up a perimeter and captured both suspects.
The victim reported that while he was sleeping, someone entered the apartment. The suspect opened the door, then quickly closed the door and took off.

A contractor came to the residence and found the suspects inside. The contractor chased the suspects. One suspect had a pistol. The suspects fled in a vehicle that was later abandoned. Officers impounded the vehicle.
Someone entered the residence. The victim awoke, yelled at the suspect and chased him out of the residence. No property was taken.

Victim was asleep when he was awakened by the sound of breaking glass. The male suspect, possibly a teen, walked into the victim's bedroom. Victim yelled at the suspect who fled the location. Victim went downstairs and observed that a rear window was smashed and rear door was open. No property was stolen.

Victim returned home to see suspects walking behind the residence. There was no evidence of a crime and victim went to bed. Victims later woke up to find a living room light on, an open window and the rear door open. Victim again saw suspects behind the residence and called the police. Victim's property was found and the two suspects were arrested.

The victim was lying in her bed when she observed the suspect at her window, attempting to get in. The suspect removed the window screen and pried open the window before he was startled and took off, before he was able to get inside.

Officers responded to a hot prowl call. Victim said that suspect was banging on windows with a hammer. Suspect had entered the back yard and forced open the rear door to the residence. Suspect fled once and came back before officers arrived. Suspect fled over the back fence.

Victim was asleep when he heard a crashing sound. Victim went into his living room and confronted two male suspects. The suspects fled. The victim's front door had been smashed in but no property had been taken.
Officers received a burglary alarm call. A rear, glass door on the second floor of the business had been smashed. Prior burglary of computers at this location.

At attempted burglary occurred at the residence. However, the suspect did not enter the location as one of the occupants yelled at the suspect when her bedroom door opened from the backyard. While officers were investigating that call, another burglary also occurred on Bakman. The husband and wife were asleep in the home. The women heard footsteps and woke up her husband who checked the location and discovered that a window was opened, the screen removed and their property had been gone through by an unknown number of suspects. The victim did not call the police, but rather flagged officers down as he looked for the suspects himself. No suspects were seen at either of the above two calls.
Suspects forced entry into victim's apartment. Victim confronted the suspects in a bedroom. One suspect attempted to hit the victim. Suspects fled. No property was taken.

The victim awoke to find the suspect staring at her while she slept. The suspect fled the location but was later seen by witnesses crawling back to the location in his underwear, carrying his clothing. The suspect did not re-contact the victim.
Officers responded to a burglary call and arrested the suspect.
Suspect(s) pried open a side kitchen window and entered the residence. Victim confronted one suspect and scared the suspects away. Suspects fled in a vehicle.

Suspect, male black in his 20s, attempted to enter the victim's apartment through a window while victim was taking a shower. Additional residents of the apartment came home and saw suspect attempting the entry. Suspect fled on foot. No property was taken.

The suspect tried to get into an apartment and was scared off by barking dogs. He then went to another apartment and attempted to get in there, but when people spoke to him, he claimed to be moving into the location and took off as officers arrived. He was taken into custody without incident.

Suspect jumped onto a balcony at the location and removed a window screen. Residents were inside and screamed when they saw suspect. Officers were able to arrest the suspect as he walked away from the location.

Officers responded to a Code 30. The roof of a Rite Aid appeared to be breached. A K/9 search was conducted with negative results. Further investigation revealed that the suspect never entered the location.

Suspects knocked on victims' door and announced that they were the police. Before the door could be opened, the suspects kicked in the door. Suspects used extension cords from the residence to tie the victims up. Suspects ransacked the apartment and found a small safe. The suspects pistol-whipped the victims to obtain the key to the safe.
Suspect(s) attempted to kick in the front door around this time but fled when occupant made a noise.
Suspect broke into residence through a window. Suspect was scared off when he encountered victim.
The suspect removed the screen from the window, pried open the window and broke into the residence. When the victim spotted the suspect on stairwell, the suspect took off in an unknown direction.
The suspect entered the residence through an unlocked kitchen window while one of the victims was asleep. When the second victim arrived home, the suspect fled through the kitchen window.

The victim was parked in front of the business, utilizing the fresh water dispensing machine. The suspect approached and demanded the victim’s car keys. The victim did not understand English and offered change to the suspect. The suspect again, demanded the keys, this time in Spanish, to which the victim replied she did not have them. The victim observed people walking nearby and yelled, causing the suspect to flee on foot. The store surveillance system captured footage of the suspect while he was in the store.

Three suspects forcibly stopped the victim’s vehicle, beat the victim with fists and a hammer, and demanded the victim’s vehicle, wallet and money. Officers located the suspects and the vehicle in the area of Samoa and Tujunga Canyon, a frequent hang of Toonerville gang members. The suspects were booked for 664/215 PC attempt carjacking.
properties.injuries: Injuries to face/cheek, calf swelling, bruising

properties.synopsis: Two males approached the victim at the Orange Line bus stop. Suspects offered to give the victim a ride but the victim refused. The suspects left but returned minutes later in a vehicle and then attempted to force the victim into the vehicle. The victim fought off the suspects.

Victim was stopped at a red light when the suspects' pulled up. The passenger asked the victim a question. The victim answered with expletives. One suspect pointed a pistol at the victim. Suspect one fired one round, hitting the victim's vehicle, as victim drove away.

Victim was walking to a friend's house when he observed the two suspects tagging a wall. The suspects asked the victim, "Where are you from?" The victim responded, "No where." One suspect pulled out a knife and stabbed the victim in the abdomen. Suspects fled.
Suspect had a knife and threatened to kill the victim. Witness restrained the suspect from stabbing the victim.

Victim was on the street providing back-up support during a drug sale when a vehicle approached. One suspect exited the vehicle and shouted, "Don't move." Suspect then fired the pistol, hitting the victim in the neck and shoulder. Suspect fled in car driven by the second suspect. Victim was taking to a hospital in stable condition.
Victim and suspect were arguing over a woman. Suspect pointed a gun at the victim. The victim and suspect struggled over the pistol. The suspect regained the weapon and pistol-whipped the victim.

Suspect and victim, roommates, had an argument over one being from another country. Both were intoxicated. Suspect used a butcher knife to stab the victim in the back and shoulder. Suspect was arrested.
Victim and girlfriend met with the girlfriend's ex-boyfriend. Suspect approached the victim and began to cut the victim on the face and neck. Victim was taken to Valley Presbyterian Hospital.

The victim was walking south on Winnetka when the suspects, described as male Hispanics, approached in a vehicle. The front passenger yelled out, "Where are you from?" The victim replied, "Nowhere." The suspect then yelled out and fired shots from a handgun. The victim was struck in the leg and was taken to a local hospital.

The victim was at a party when he was confronted by a male Hispanic who asked him “Are you banging, where are you from?” The suspect then punched the victim on the face. The suspect removed a gun from his waistband and then shot the victim two times. The victim was taken to a local hospital where he was treated for his injuries and listed in stable condition.
properties.injuries: Gunshot wound to chest and arm

properties.synopsis: Two male suspects, each with pistols, walked up to three male victims who were standing in the street in front of a residence. Suspects fired 12 rounds at the victims and then fled on foot. Victims were not injured by the gunfire.

Suspect and victim were involved in a physical altercation. Suspect drew a pistol from his waistband and fired at the victim. Victim was not hit. Suspect ran to his vehicle and fled location. Victim knew the suspect and directed officers to the suspect's home. Suspect was arrested.
The suspect showed the bank teller a note indicating that she was armed and wanted money. The teller refused and the suspect took off.

A vehicle with juveniles drove up to the vict as he was walking home. One of them got out of the vehicle and asked the victim where his wallet was. The victim felt the suspect may have had a weapon so the victim pushed the suspect away, and the suspect fled location. The suspect was located and arrested.

Four male Hispanic suspects in a black, newer model Chrysler approached two victims, who were walking. One suspect exited the car and attempted to hit one victim and also asking the victims what gang they were from. The suspect then produced a pistol and pointed it at one victim's head. Suspect with gun said, "Give me your money or I'll shoot you." Victims fled the location without giving up any property.
properties.address: Sherman Way and White Oak Avenue

properties.synopsis: Three suspects approached the victim and demanded money. When the victim told the suspects he had no money, one suspect pulled a boxcutter and cut the victim in the abdomen. Then all three suspects took off.

Suspect (1) simulated a gun and demanded Victims money. Victim stated are you serious. Then Suspect (2) punched the Victim causing him to fall to the ground. Suspect (1), (2) began punching the Victim as Suspect (1) stabbed the Victim while Suspect (2) attempted to take victims property. Suspects fled on foot as the Victim was following them. The Suspects entered a car and left location. The Victim discovered he was bleeding and was transported to a local hospital by LAFD and treated for lacerations to his forearm and puncture wounds to his torso. The victim is in stable condition.
Suspect gave demand note to a bank teller but fled the bank before getting any money.

The suspect walked up to the counter with his shirt pulled over his nose and mouth. The suspect simulated a handgun and demanded the money from the cash register. The employee fled as the suspect attempted to force open the register and no money was taken. The suspect went behind the counter and grabbed an employee and forced her into the office. The suspect demanded the employee to open the safe. The employee was unable to open the safe.
properties.address: Victory Boulevard and Coldwater Canyon Avenue

properties.synopsis: Officers responded to the business and met with the store manager. The officers learned that a suspect forced his way into the store and at gunpoint ordered a witness to the cash office and for that person to punch in the code to open the door. The witness, not knowing the code, pleaded with the suspect not to be shot. After not making any headway with the witness the suspect fled the store. The witness explained to the officers that he believes the suspect is a former employee due to the fact he knew where everything was in the store.

Victim was sitting in her car when suspects pulled up next to her in their car. One suspect pointed a gun at the victim and demanded money. Suspect exited his car and attempted to take victim's purse. Victim struggled with suspect and screamed. Suspects fled. No property taken. Suspects' vehicle was a dark green Toyota.
Someone entered the business, simulated a handgun, and demanded money. The suspect fled the location without property when the person reporting the case fled to the rear office to call the police.

A victim was on a bus when she observed suspect-1 exit the bus and remove her bicycle from the bus bike rack. As the suspect rode off slowly on her bicycle, the victim chased the suspect and applied the brakes on the bicycle, causing the suspect to fall.  The victim wrestled the suspect for control of the bicycle and managed to get away as she rode back towards Ventura Boulevard.  Suspects 2-7 threw small rocks in her direction. One rock struck the victim on the back of her head but did not cause any injuries.  Victim was able to get on another bus to call the police.
The suspect produced a handgun and ordered the victim into his residence. The victim closed the door on the suspect as he entered and the suspect took off.
Officers saw two men running after another male. Victim was knocked to the ground and was being punched. One suspect was arrested after a foot pursuit. Victim said one suspect demanded money.

Suspect drove up in a dark Buick, exited and pointed a pistol at the victim. Suspect demanded the victim to put his hands up as he seached him. Suspect got back into his car and fled the scene. No property was taken.
properties.address: Topanga Canyon Boulevard and Kittridge Street

properties.synopsis: Victim was walking home from Lucy's 51 when he was confronted by the suspect. The suspect stated, "Give me your money." The victim, thinking that the suspect was joking said, "What's the magic word?" The suspect became angry and struck the victim with a cane. The victim and the suspect struggled until the victim was able to take the cane away. The suspect fled on foot.
properties.address: East-west alley south of Riverside Drive and Mariota Avenue

properties.synopsis: LAPD officers surrounded a McDonald’s in North Hollywood and searched for a man who tried to rob the eatery while apparently pretending to have a handgun, but he got away. The man entered the restaurant during business hours and used his sweatshirt to cover his face while simulating a handgun beneath it, he said. He demanded money from employees, who slipped inside a rear storeroom, locked the door and phoned police, Butler said. Police arrived, ushered everyone out of the restaurant, set up a perimeter and searched for the man, who apparently fled on foot empty-handed, he said. The suspect was described as a black man, 25-30 years old, 6 feet tall and 200 pounds. He was wearing a gray sweatshirt over a dark-colored shirt.
properties.address: Coldwater Canyon Avenue and Victory Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Two male suspects, described as Hispanic or black, about 25-years-old, approached the victim in his front yard. One suspect simulated a handgun and tried to steal a computer from the victim. The victim refused to give up the computer. The suspect took off in a vehicle.

Two victims were in the El Pollo parking lot when they were approached by the suspect. Suspect demanded money and property. When the victims refused, the suspect grabbed victim one from behind and stabbed him in the chest, right arm and chin. Victim two intervened and was stabbed once in the neck. Suspect fled. None of the victims' wounds were life-threatening.

The suspects tried to remove the outdoor ATM machine by wrapping a chain around it and using their vehicle to tear it loose. The suspects were unsuccessful and were last seen driving north on Woodman toward Valerio.

Officers responded to a radio call of two males on the roof attempting to steal an air-conditioning unit. Responding units observed one suspect on the rooftop. A perimeter was established and both suspects were subsequently taken into custody without incident. Both suspects were booked for attempt grand theft.

Victim and suspect were drinking together when they started an argument. Victim was standing near a staircase when the suspect pushed victim, who fell down the stairs. Victim was taken to a hospital with a major head trauma.

An intoxicated victim was punched by an unknown suspect. The victim fell and struck his head on the pavement. The victim was transported to the hospital where they determined the victim was suffering from internal bleeding. The victim was listed in critical condition.

The victim, described as a 40-year-old male, was sitting in his car in the post office parking lot, waiting for his girlfriend, when the suspect, described as male white between 30 and 40, approached. The suspect stated to the victim "I need a hundred dollars and I need transportation." The victim was not in fear and ignored the suspect. The suspect then stated "leave a hundred dollars on the seat and leave the key." Then the victim's girlfriend returned to the car and the suspect turned away. The victim then saw the handle of a semi-automatic pistol in the suspect's pocket. There were no injuries and no property was taken.

Officers responded to a brush fire. The Los Angeles Fire Department responded and extinguished the fire approximately an hour later. Due to the suspicious nature of the fire, the Fire Department determined arson was involved and would handle the investigation.
Suspect(s) entered location through unlocked sliding glass door and removed property. Suspects left through sliding door.
Suspect pried open a window and reached into occupied residence. Suspect fled when encountered by the resident. Suspect was arrested by officers.
Suspect attempted to gain entry to residence through a window but fled when residents saw him.
Suspect broke into two locations and took keys from each. Suspect was detained, found to be under the influence of a stimulant and arrested.
Suspects entered the business from a rear door. Suspects stole electronics and exited out the rear door. There were no signs of forced entry.

Someone went into the location and took six Picasso paintings worth $100,000. The reporting party is the executor of the estate. The owner of the property is deceased. Detectives are conducting the investigation.

Suspects entered the front door, went to the bookkeeper's office and covered the camera. They were unable to open the safe. They tried a second office but were unable to steal any property. A third male suspect stayed inside the vehicle when the two were inside the business.

Someone broke into a home and stole a safe on Thursday sometime between 9:30 a.m. and 1 p.m. in the 16400 block of Garvin Drive. The thieves broke through a rear door, disabled the alarm and ransacked the house. They took a small portable safe inside the closet which contained jewelry and cash and went out the front door.

Suspect(s) reached through an unlocked rear window to unlock the rear door. Suspect(s) removed a laptop computer and left through the front door. Victim heard the suspect but believed it was a relative or invited guest.
Suspect pried open sliding door and entered the victim's apartment. Victim observed the suspect and fled the apartment.
Suspect entered through rear French doors at a gated residence. Suspect(s) were selective in property taken, only jewelry and cash. Suspect left residence through the French doors.
Unknown suspect(s) pried open the lock of a rear glass sliding door to gain entry.  Suspect(s) removed property and fled location.

Officers responded to a burglary at a jewelry store in the Sherman oaks Fashion Center. This store was burglarized in January. Suspects gained access to the mall through an unlocked door. Suspects smashed the glass display windows at the store. Display cases were ransacked. The suspects stole items valued at over $100,000. Video recorded the burglary.

Suspect entered victim’s residence through a rear window. Victim came home, surprised the suspects, who then fled. The original crime was listed as home invasion robbery because suspects had guns and duct tape, and appeared to be possibly lying in wait for someone other than victim. No property taken.
Victim said she was storing a safe in the garage at this location for one week. When she returned for the safe, she discovered it and the contents were missing.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim said that the suspect(s) took property from her bedroom.
Suspect(s) entered several residences and stole jewelery, cash and a handgun.

Unknown person(s) entered an open bedroom window after removing its screen. The unknown suspect(s) removing the victims property from the bedroom and did not enter any other room in the house.  The victim was in the front of the house during the incident.

The victim stated she had secured her home and went to bed at approximately 8:30 a.m., when she awoke at approximately 1 p.m. the same day, she discovered that an unknown suspect had removed her louvered windows and entered her home. Further investigation revealed $30 was taken from her nightstand, which was located next to her bed. The officer's investigation revealed unknown suspect(s) removed the louvers to her bedroom window and entered the victim's residence and removed her property. The suspect(s) looked around the rest of the residence and left through the front door.

The suspect knocked on the victim’s door. When the victim did not answer, the suspect went to the rear yard, smashed out a rear window and attempted to break into the house. The victim confronted the suspect, who took off.
Suspect(s) entered the residence through an unlocked garage door. Suspect(s) stole a gun and other property.

Victim left her house at 10 a.m. and, when she returned at 12:30 p.m., noticed that money was missing. Suspect(s) had entered the home while victim's mother and brother were home but they did not see or hear anyone.
Suspect was observed removing property by private security guard. Officers responded to the call and took the suspect into custody. Victim's property was returned.
Officers responded to a burglary call. Suspect(s) entered residence through an unlocked rear door and removed property.

Officers responded to a call of a burglary in progress at a check cashing business. Officers saw suspects' vehicle leaving the location. Cash register drawers, pry tools and gloves were found inside the vehicle when driver was pulled over. Suspects were arrested.
Officers respond to a burglary in progress. Officers arrested two for possessing burglary tools. There was no evidence of burglary at the location.

Unknown suspect(s) smashed out the window at the business, entered the location and removed approximately $9,000 in property. Suspect(s) fled in an unknown direction with the property. Prior to officer's arrival, the window had been replaced. No prints were
attempted.
Suspect(s) kicked in front door and removed property.

Officers responded to a burglary investigation. The investigation revealed the Suspect had entered the residence through an unlocked sliding glass door in the kitchen area. The suspect took the victim’s purse from the kitchen table and fled the location. Victim was in another room at the time of the incident.
Suspect(s) entered closed bedroom window and stole jewelry. Suspect left residence through a sliding glass door.
The suspect entered the victim’s residence through a sliding glass door and removed cash, jewelry, a television and computer.
Suspect(s) entered the house through an unlocked rear door while victim was asleep. Property was stolen. Suspect(s) left through rear door.

The suspect cut through a rear screen door to get into the victim's residence. The suspect ransacked the master bedroom and took jewelry. Before leaving, the suspect stood at the edge of a hallway and yelled, "Hey you!" to the victim, who was sitting in the living room reading a paper. The victim turned toward the suspect as he was running out of the house, but did not get a good look at the suspect.

Officers responded to the location and found an open door. They made contact with a female at the location who stated that she had woken to find a man crouched next to her bed. He left when she woke up. She stated that she had not been touched, nor did anything seem to have been taken. The investigation revealed the suspect entered the location by forcing a window open and left through the door the officer found to be open. A shoe print and possible fingerprints were found. Two similar incidents occurred last week in the same area.
The suspects forced entry into the business and removed property. The suspects fled in a vehicle.

Officers responded to a radio call of a "459 Hot Prowl" at the above location. On scene investigation revealed that the victim left her home at about 8:30 a.m. Victim left the rear window to her residence ajar and left her cell phone on the table as she was only going to be gone from her residence a short while. When she returned, she observed a man, 18-20 years of age, ransacking the front closet of her residence. Upon being discovered, the suspect fled and entered a red vehicle, with red writing on paper plates and tinted windows driven by suspect two, a man.

The victim was sleeping in the bedroom when he was awoken by a sound from the living room. When he went to investigate, he surprised the suspect who was tampering with the stereo. The suspect took off out the front door where victim saw a second suspect standing by the apartment complex. Both suspects ran west on Blythe.
Unknown suspects entered the victim’s residence through a bathroom window, ransacked rooms, broke open a safe and took property.

Victim told officers that sometime during the night someone crawled through the rear doggy door, entered her home and removed property. Victim's purse was missing and rear door was unlocked. Footprints in the back yard were photographed.
Someone smashed the window to gain entry into the residence, then took property and disappeared.
Unknown suspects cut a hole in the roof of the business and fled the location with merchandise through the front door. The suspects disarmed the alarm system.

The victim was inside his residence when the suspect entered through an unlocked sliding door. The suspect took cash and fled the location and the victim was unable to describe the suspect.  However, a witness observed a female approach the victim's residence. A short time later, he observed the same female run back into the vehicle as it left the location.
An elderly woman was taking a shower when someone went into her residence and removed jewelry and cash.
Someone smashed through a window of a business and took the safe containing money.

Suspect(s) smashed a hole in a window at this clothing business but no entry was made through window. Suspect(s) returned one to two hours later and entered a rear door by unknown means. Suspect(s) stole property. The power and alarm to the business were disabled but portions of the burglary were caught on camera and depict two males committing the crime.

Between 5 p.m. November 9 and 8:30 a.m. November 10, unknown suspects pried open a window of the residence to gain entry. Suspect(s) removed property and keys to victim's vehicle.  Suspect(s) fled with the victim's property, including the victim's vehicle.

Victim was asleep when she awoke at 1 a.m. and noticed that her computer was on and the keyboard had been moved. Her money and a cell phone were missing. Victim told officers she might have left her door unlocked.

Victim was inside her residence when she heard a suspect enter. Victim ran outside to phone the police. She observed a woman sitting in a white SUV. The male suspect exited the residence , pointed the pistol at the victim and ordered her to go back inside the house. The male suspect entered the SUV and left the location.
Someone broke into a vacant commercial building and removed copper wire.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation and were advised by the victim that someone entered through an open window and took $20,000 in jewelry. A male Hispanic juvenile was seen in the area.

Officers responded to a radio call regarding a "hot prowl" burglary.  Investigation revealed that the suspect entered the location through the unlocked front door. The victim heard a noise and observed the suspect crawling through her bedroom door. The victim screamed, causing the suspect to jump up and run from the location, back through the front door. Unknown if any property had been taken.
Someone pried open the side door with and unknown tool and removed approximately $12,000 in computer equipment, including the computer housing the security video.
The suspect(s) kicked open the front door of a business and removed an ATM machine.

The victim woke to noises and lights that appeared to be outside her residence. After checking her residence, she fell back asleep.  When the victim woke up, she discovered that suspects had shattered her rear door window and entered her residence. The suspects fled the location prior to the victim waking up.
Someone entered the victim’s residence through an open window and took approximately $28,000 in jewelry and electronic equipment.

Victim was asleep when she heard noises. She went from her bedroom to the living room and observed a suspect running from her apartment with her property. She attempted to follow the suspect and then observed another male running, too. Victim lost the suspects inside her apartment complex.

The victim and her family were asleep inside her residence when suspect(s) used gardening shears to cut open a screen door, enter the location and take property. No suspect was seen. The suspect took wallets and purses. The crime took place between 3 a.m. and 5 a.m.

Two suspects entered the residence and were confronted by the residents who were at home. The suspects fled the location via the rear door that leads to the alley. Officers responded and with the aid of the air unit, searched the area. The suspects were able to escape the scene.

A 16-year-old victim was home alone when she heard a knock at the front door. She looked out the window and saw the suspect walk into her backyard. The victim, in fear, ran upstairs into her room to call her father. The victim heard a noise at the back door.  The suspect then entered her bedroom, made eye contact, and fled the location without taking any property.

A victim was in the bedroom of his residence when he heard a loud noise. The victim looked out into the living room where he observed a dark shadow. The victim walked into the living room and observed the rear door leading to the backyard had been pried open. No property was taken.
Unknown suspect(s) pried the front door open to gain entry. Suspect(s) ransacked the residence and removed property. Suspect(s) fled out the front door with the victim's property.
The victim returned home and saw a suspect inside the residence. The suspect immediately fled with property including a Blackberry.
Victim was taking a shower when she heard a noise. She discovered a screen from her bedroom window had been removed. No suspect was seen.

Victim was awakened by noises in her house. Victim's mother also heard noises and voices. suspect(s) stole a television and a VCR from the living room. Suspect(s) had entered the house by cutting a screen on an open window on the side of the house.
Unknown suspect(s) entered the location by removing the kitchen window. Suspect(s) removed property from a small safe located inside a closet and fled in an unknown direction.

A suspect entered a vacant house (the owners were out of town) and possibly overdosed on drugs. Officers observed extensive damage to the residence. The suspect was treated for his injuries and transported to St. Joseph's Medical Center. The suspect was admitted into the hospital for kidney failure. The suspect had a parole warrant and was arrested for burglary.

The victim had guests at her residence until 2:30 a.m., at which time, she went to sleep. At about 5 a.m. hours, the victim awoke and observed the suspect at the foot of her bed. The suspect then fled the residence with the victim's cell phone. The victim called her cell phone and the suspect answered; he told the victim that he knew who she was and told her not to cause any trouble.

The suspect entered the residence of a 24-year old female through a sliding screen door. The victim was in bed when the suspect awakened her by hitting her on the head and arms with his fists. The suspect did not state anything and the victim was able to fight him off. The suspect fled from the location. The suspect was described as having a shaved head and no shirt. The victim was treated and released at Northridge Hospital for bumps and bruises.
Victim returned home to find suspect exiting her bedroom with her property. Suspect fled the location and got into a green Toyota driven by the second suspect.
Unknown suspect(s) pried open the rear door and dragged a safe from the bedroom to the living room. Suspects fled from the point of entry with property found in the safe.

One victim was asleep when suspect(s) entered the residence through a locked front door. Second victim arrived home, saw the door ajar and property missing. Victim who was asleep did not hear or see anything.

Suspects entered the main house, unoccupied, through an unlocked door. Victim's property was placed in pillow cases. Suspect(s) removed a window screen and slid open a window and started to enter a guest house. Victim armed himself with a sledge hammer and swung it toward the window. Suspects fled in foot in an unknown direction.

Suspect(s) entered the business and attempted to tunnel through the wall to access the neighboring athletic shoe business. The noise from the suspects’ activities alerted residents who lived on the top floor. The residents witnessed two male Hispanics between 20 and 30-years-old driving an older model green pickup truck.

Victim was inside his residence when he heard a noise on the third floor of his residence. Victim observed suspect attempting to open the locked sliding balcony door. Suspect saw victim and consequently climbed down a palm tree, ran through the yard, jumped a fence and fled in an unknown direction.
Someone cut a hole in the warehouse door and removed electronics and televisions.
Suspect(s) entered the residence through an unlocked sliding glass door while the victims were asleep. The suspect(s) removed property and left through the sliding glass door.

The suspects entered the business, pretending to be customers. One of the suspects distracted the employee at the electronics counter while the other suspects pried open a display case and stole approximately 17 IPods. Suspects fled in two vehicles. Surveillance video caught the burglary.
The victim awoke and discovered the suspect standing in his kitchen. The suspect saw the victim and took off.
Suspect(s) smashed front window of a business with a tire iron that was left at the location. Suspect(s) entered and stole property.
Officers responded to a burglary call. Victim said that someone had entered his residence through the rear door and removed property.

The victim was asleep in her bedroom with her husband when she awoke to a small stature woman with a heavy odor of perfume in her bedroom. The suspect was going through the husband’s pants’ pockets. When the suspect left, she also took the victim’s purse. The victim was too afraid to wake her husband. When the victim finally told her husband, they discovered that their car was gone from its parking stall.

Victim said she heard a noise in her home but dismissed the idea that suspect(s) was inside her residence. She later discovered that her wallet was missing. There were no signs of forced entry but victim had left doors unlocked while she was at home.
Unknown suspect(s) entered a bedroom through an unlocked window and took victim's property. Victim's mother was home but did not hear or see the anyone enter the residence.
Suspects broke the lock on a delivery truck, removed property and took off in a mini-van.

Victims were sleeping when unknown suspect(s) entered their residence and removed 15 paintings. The couple was unaware that suspects had been in their house and the property missing until a housekeeper arrived for work and made the discovery. The incident happened sometime late Aug. 22 to early Aug. 23.
Suspect(s) kicked in the front door to the residence and removed electronics and jewelry.
The suspect(s) entered a business through the front door and removed jewelry and computers. The suspect(s) then took off.
The victim awoke and saw the suspect looking at him from the bedroom doorway. The suspect then took off through an open kitchen window and disappeared with property.
The victim returned home to find her front door and window open and residence ransacked. Someone removed property from the location.
Victim reported that items, including a Rolex and money, had been missing since August 2008. The money was stored in a duffle bag and had last been seen two weeks ago.
Suspect(s) entered the kitchen door while victims were asleep. Suspect(s) entered the attached garage and stole a 2007 Lexus.

The victim said she awoke and saw the suspect standing in the corner of her room. The victim stood up from her bed and was able to walk out of her room. The victim fled her apartment to a neighbor's. The suspect fled without being seen. There were no signs of a break-in. The victim was unable to describe the suspect and no property was taken.

The victim was in the bathroom when she heard a knock at the front door but did not answer. The victim got out of the bathroom and saw the suspect standing in the living room. The suspect walked out the front door with the victim’s property and took off. The victim had seen the suspect earlier knocking on the neighbor’s door.
Suspect(s) broke a window and entered victim's apartment.
The victim returned home after being away for 2 ½ hours and discovered someone removed property from his bedroom. Someone got into the victim's residence by prying the side door.
Suspects entered the location by using a crowbar to pry open the rear door. Suspects removed approximately $50,000 worth of cell phones.
Victim scared off the suspects before they could steal any property.

While the victims were asleep, someone used a wrench to break into the side window of the residence. The suspects entered the residence, ransacked the location and removed the victims’ property. The suspects got out of the residence through a side door. The crime occurred sometime between 1:30 a.m. and 4 a.m.
Someone unscrewed the mail slot and reached inside to open the door. The suspect(s) removed property from the business.
Suspect entered victim's residence through the rear door. Suspect was walking up the stairs when victim confronted suspect. Suspect fled on foot.

Suspect(s) knocked on victim's door. When victim didn't answer, suspects entered the residence through an unlocked back door. One suspect was carrying a plasma TV out of the house when the victim saw the suspects and screamed. Suspects fled to a waiting green Sentra with the TV.

Victim was house-sitting and asleep in an upstairs bedroom. Awakened by noises downstairs, the victim went to investigate and saw that a television had been pried away from a wall and stolen. No suspect(s) were seen and there was no evidence of forced entry.
Someone broke into a residence and removed jewelry from a bedroom dresser.

One victim was outside gardening. The other victim was inside when she observed two male suspects outside. She heard the back door, unlocked, open. Sometime later, the victim who had been outside, came in and discovered jewelry missing from her bedroom.
Suspect entered the victim's home through a screen door. Victim awoke, saw the suspect but thought it was her husband returning from work and went back to sleep. Suspect stole property.

Officers responded to a call at a restaurant. Two males, wearing ski masks, attempted to kick in the back door. Suspects observed several employees in the restaurant and then fled in a four-door sedan. No property was taken.
Victim was inside when he heard a noise. He looked out a window and saw suspect fleeing. Suspect stole a bracelet and a laptop computer.
Suspect(s) pried open the rear door to the pharmacy and stole unknown medications.

Officers responded to the location on a burglary call. Officers met a Realtor who said residence is for sale. Location was locked on Nov. 15, 2008 but on returning, Realtor said the back door had been forced open and kitchen items had been removed. The items taken included a stove, microwave, double oven and a dishwasher. Several tools, which may have been used by suspect(s), had been left behind.
Suspect(s) entered residence and stole money and jewelry.

The victim was asleep in his bedroom when he awoke and observed the suspect (a Hispanic male) crawling next to the bed. The victim chased the suspect outside and then called police. No property was taken.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim alleged that the suspect took us currency, jewelry, computer, and camera.
The suspect entered the victim’s residence through an unlocked window, ransacked the location and removed property. The incident occurred sometime between 10:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m.

The victim was asleep in his bedroom when he awoke and observed the suspect (a Hispanic male) crawling next to the bed. The victim chased the suspect outside and then called police. No property was taken.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim alleged that the suspect took us currency, jewelry, computer, and camera.
Someone broke into the victim’s residence by smashing a window. Once inside, the person ransacked the residence and fled with property.
The 90-year old victim said a suspect broke into her residence and stole money.
Victims were awakened by sounds in their home but did not immediately investigate. Upon awakening, victims discovered property missing.

Victim was asleep when she heard a knock at the door. Victim did not answer the knock. Victim went to the bathroom and then heard footsteps. She also heard the suspect talking. Suspect attempted to enter the locked bathroom. Suspect fled the residence and victim discovered her cell phone outside.

Suspects entered the residence by smashing a rear window. Suspects ransacked the residence while a witness was in her rented room. Suspects fled with property. Witness heard the window being smashed and observed a suspect but beleived he was a relative of one of the other five renters.
Someone burglarized the victim’s business by kicking open the front door and removing property.

Two male suspects, one with a pistol, entered the residence through a side door. The female homeowner and a housekeeper were ordered onto a bedroom floor while one suspect ransacked the residence. The suspects were moving the victims into the living room when the male homeowner entered the residence. suspects stole watch, money and cell phone before leaving.
Suspect(s) forced a sliding glass door open and removed property while husband and wife slept upstairs.
Officers responded to a burglary call where unknown suspect(s) entered the victim's residence through a doggy door. Suspect(s) ransacked the victim's bedroom and removed property.

Victim lives at the residence with several roommates. Victim left for work and upon returning discovered his plasma TV was missing from his room. There was no evidence of forced entry into the residence. One roommate had been asleep in his room, officers learned, and had heard the front door close about the time the burglary may have occurred.
Suspect(s) entered location by prying open a rear window. Suspects damaged three company vehicles. No property was taken.
Suspect entered residence while victim was asleep. Victim woke up and saw suspect in her bedroom. Suspect fled out the front door with victim's purse and laptop computer.
A vehicle belonging to an ICE agent was burglarized. The victim's work ID, badge, work entry card and government credit card were taken.

The victim's boyfriend left the apartment without locking the front door while the victim was sleeping. The boyfriend returned and observed that unknown suspect(s) had entered the victim's apartment and removed the victim's purse and laptop computer while the victim was sleeping in the bedroom.
Suspect(s) pried the front door open, stole jewelry and money and ransacked the location.
Suspect(s), between 2 a.m. and noon, entered the business by forcing open a rear door and stole property.

Officers responded to a call that a possible burglary suspect was being held. The suspect ran away before officers arrived but was found and arrested. The suspect had cut a lock on a backyard fence to gain entry into the yard. The suspect was seen by neighbors.
Suspect(s) entered the business by cutting through a security gate and breaking a window. Cell phone related inventory was stolen. The surveillance video was also stolen.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim stated unknown suspect(s) took property from her bedroom.

The suspect knocked on the victim’s front door. The suspect then removed the screen from the garage door and opened an unlocked window and got in. The suspect removed jewelry from the bedroom area and left the way he came in. The victim heard noises, looked out her window and saw the suspect leaving the location.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim claimed unknown suspect(s) removed a safe containing property.
Someone broke through the side window of the victim's residence and removed jewelry and fled out the front door.
Officers responded to a call of burglary with suspect leaving the location. Suspect was detained.

Victim kept gold and silver coins in his unlocked, backyard shed. He last saw the coins on Sept. 1, 2008. He discovered that the coins were missing on this date. Victim made the police report on 1/7/09.
Victim was asleep when suspect(s) opened an unlocked window and stole a TV.
Suspect(s) broke a window and entered residence while victim was asleep. Victim woke up and went to investigate. Suspect(s) startled and fled through a rear door with victim's property.

The victim left a rear door to her residence, a mobile home, unlocked. She fell asleep at 11 p.m. She woke up at approximately 1:45 a.m. and discovered her purse that was next to her bed was missing. Her purse contained credit cards, currency and a gold watch. A roll of coins belonging to victim was also discovered outside the residence. No suspects were seen or heard.

Someone entered a residence via an open sliding glass door as the victim and his wife were sleeping. The victim's wife saw a suspect in the hallway and woke up. The victim chased the suspect out of the apartment. No property was taken. The victim believed the suspect was possibly visiting another apartment in the building, but was unable to identify him.
Suspect(s) pried open rear bathroom window at the residence. Suspect(s) pried open a safe that was bolted to the floor in a bedroom. Suspect(s) left through a garage door with jewelry and bonds.

Suspect entered victims; residence through an unlocked front door. One victim heard someone trying to enter, went to investigate and saw suspect standing in the entryway. One victim confronted suspect. Suspect fled.
Suspects entered the location with keys and dressed as a cleaning crew. Suspects removed property. Suspects were observed on surveillance video.
Suspect(s) possibly entered the victim's residence through an unlocked, rear sliding glass door. Victim was asleep when suspect(s) stole property and left through the sliding glass door.
Suspect entered victim's residence through an unlocked rear door, went to a bedroom and removed cash. Victim saw suspect and screamed. Suspect left with the money.
Someone entered the victim’s residence through an unlocked window, ransacked the victim’s residence and removed property.
Suspect(s) entered location by prying open sliding glass door. Suspect(s) removed jewelry.
Someone got into a residence while the victim was on vacation, ransacked it and removed various items, including a car. The loss was estimated at $80,000.
Someone pried through a rear door, ransacked the residence and removed property.
Victim walked into her living room and observed suspect standing there. Suspect fled out a side door. Victim did not observe any property missing and did not see any forced entry.
Suspect(s) gained access from the roof and took electrical items including panel boards, fuses and wiring.
Suspect(s) entered the residence from the rear alley and through a side bedroom window. Suspect(s) removed jewelry and a TV.

A female resident of a townhouse was in her upstairs room when she heard loud banging coming from downstairs, but assumed it was her roommate. She discovered that someone had broken into the garage door, kicked open the door to the kitchen and got inside the location to remove property. Officers checked with neighbors, but there were no witnesses.

The family was inside their apartment with the window open for ventilation. The suspect reached through an existing opening in the screen of the bedroom window and removed a Sony Play station console. No suspects were seen or heard and there was no evidence that the suspect entered the residence.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim stated unknown suspect(s) entered his residence for two consecutive days, and removed property on both days.
Victim had been out of town and upon returning saw a broken window and property missing.
Unknown susect(s) pried open the front door and took jewelry and money.
Suspect(s) entered the location through a rear window and stole property.
Suspect(s) entered backyard through a side gate. Suspect used a dumb bell weight to smash window on door. Suspect (possible ex-employee of victim) took music equipment.
Someone entered the victim’s residence through an unlocked rear door while the victim was asleep. The suspect took the victim’s property and disappeared.
Officers responded to a burglary investigation where the victim claimed someone took a small safe containing currency and property.

Someone entered the victim’s patio. The suspect then pried open the patio screen door with unknown tool. The suspect entered the residence while the victim was asleep. The suspect took the victim’s property and disappeared. The suspect also took the victim’s vehicle, which had a Lojack. The vehicle was recovered in Van Nuys.

Officers responded to a "trespass suspect there now" call. The officers determined that two suspects were inside a private residence after breaking the window.  Additional units deployed and the two suspects were arrested while attempting to run from the scene. Property taken from the victim’s residence was recovered from the scene.

Suspects entered the location with knives, guns and rolling a large suitcase. Suspects bypassed roll-up gates by cutting locks with bolt cutters. Suspects selected jewelry and left location. Officers were alerted by mall security.
Suspect(s) entered the residence and stole jewelry.
Suspect(s) entered the residence through an unlocked rear door as a family slept. Suspect(s) removed several items. A glove and coins were recovered just outside the location.
Unknown suspect(s) removed a screen and entered residence through a window as victim slept. Victim observed property missing upon awakening.
The victim stated he fell asleep at his business. When he woke up, he noticed cigarettes and cash missing from the location. The suspect(s) pried open a rear door to gain entry.
The victim stated someone removed property from his residence.
Suspect(s) cut a lock on the door to a business. Suspect(s) ransacked the business and stole boxes of clothing. Suspect(s) left through the rear door.
Suspect(s) gained entry into the residence by an unlocked rear garage door. Suspect(s) ransacked the residence and fled with property through the point of entry.
Someone got into a residence by forcing open the rear door of the rear balcony. Once inside, the person ransacked the location and removed property.
The victim stated the suspect(s) gained entry into his residence by smashing a kitchen window. The suspect(s) ransacked the residence and fled with the Victim’s property.

Victims were at church when the burglary occurred. Unknown suspect(s) pried off screen and window and entered the kitchen. Residence was ransacked and a safe was pried off of a wall. Safe was opened and money was stolen.
Unknown suspect(s) removed property from a safe that was left unlocked by the homeowner.

One suspect knocked on victim's door and waited. Second suspect used bodily force to smash a front window, reached inside and attempted to pull window from the wall. Victim, who was inside, confronted the suspects who fled. No property was taken.
Suspects(s) entered residence and stole jewelery and other small items.
Suspect(s) removed outdoor cameras and disabled the phone line. Suspect(s) cut a hole in the roof and removed approximately 400 pairs of sunglasses.
Someone smashed the rear bedroom glass door to get inside. Then the person took property from the master bedroom and disappeared.

The victim did not report the burglary until Sept. 16, 2008 at 3:50 p.m. The victim stated he was in another room when he heard a noise. The victim verbally challenged the suspect. The suspect fled without being seen by the victim. No property was taken. The suspect gained entry into the victim’s residence by cutting a window screen.

Suspect had burglarized a residence and was leaving with stolen property in a pillowcase when a neighbor observed suspicious activity. The neighbor got in his vehicle and followed the suspect but lost sight when suspect went over a fence. Officers had been called and were able to make an arrest. Home surveillance had recorded the suspect's burglary.

Three suspects were observed committing a burglary from a motor vehicle. A witness recorded the license plate number of the suspects' vehicle. Officers responded to the call and one suspect was arrested. Air Support located the other two suspects at a North Hollywood residence. A second suspect was arrested but the third eluded officers. Two suspects were booked for burglary.
Officers received a call of burglary from motor vehicles supsects. Officers saw a possible suspect, and was detained. The witnesses identified the suspect and he was arrested.

The victim had placed a FEDEX package on the right front passenger seat of his vehicle. When the victim went inside the gas station to get gas, someone smashed the right front passenger window of his vehicle and fled with the victim’s property.
properties.address: Riverside Drive and Van Nuys Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Someone broke into the driver's side of a car, took property then etched a swastika on the tailgate.

Suspects had burglarized the residence when the owner arrived home. The suspects made the victim believe that they had a gun. The suspects stole the victim's vehicle. The vehicle was Lo-Jace equipped and activated and vehicle was later located.

The victim parked her vehicle in the parking lot. Upon returning to her vehicle she was confronted by a male Hispanic suspect. The suspect had a T-Shirt covering his face, pulled a pistol and demanded the victim’s vehicle. The victim complied and gave the suspect her vehicle keys. The suspect drove off in the victim’s vehicle.
Suspect asked to test drive victim's car, which he was selling. Suspect drove off with victim's car. Suspect was arrested.
One suspect armed with a pistol, pointed it at the victim and, in Spanish, demanded victim get out of his vehicle. Victim complied and suspects fled in the vehicle.
The victims pulled into a driveway and were approached by two suspects with handguns. The gunmen demanded their property. The victims surrendered wallets, a cell phone and their vehicle.

The victim was in the parking lot of Tommy's Burgers sitting in his car a 1994 green Ford Taurus when two suspects approached him from either side of his car. One suspect pointed a gun at the victim and demanded that he give him his car keys and car. The suspect threatened that if victim did not comply, he would be shot. The suspect grabbed the victim's right arm and pulled him from the car. The suspect entered the passenger seat and a second suspect entered the driver seat of victim's car. The suspects took off east on Roscoe.

The victim, a 13-month old child, was taken to Children's Hospital as a result of a fall in the bath tub and off of a bed, while in the care of the stepfather. The physician determined that the brain trauma and body bruises were inconsistent with the stepfather's statement of what occurred. The victim is listed in critical but stable condition. The abused child unit responded to the scene and is handling the investigation.

A 4-month-old baby was admitted to the hospital with injuries consistent with "Shaken Baby" Syndrome. The child was listed in critical but stable condition. The abused-child unit responded to the hospital to assist with the investigation.

A 12-year-old victim was waiting for the school bus when a white male pulled up in a silver Toyota and attempted to gain attention. The victim in fear walked away. The suspect pulled into a parking lot and said something crude to the victim. The victim ran towards a sheriff's deputy across the street and the suspect took off north.

Officers arrested the female suspect for leaving her 18-month-old child in a vehicle with the windows up while she entered a store and remained there for 20 minutes. The internal temperature of the vehicle measured 101 degrees. The child was transported to Valley Presbyterian hospital where the baby was treated for heat exposure and released.

The victim is Jewish. The suspect stated that he did not like Jews and threatened to have Nazis and Arabs physically harm the victim. The victim was in fear of his safety.  The subject was taken into custody and booked for making criminal threats.
Officers responded to a death investigation involving a 5-day-old child. The abused child unit responded to conduct the investigation. No evidence of foul play was observed.
Officers responded to a call of a body on the railroad tracks. Death listed as undetermined at this time.
properties.address: railroad tracks north of Kester Avenue and Raymer Street

properties.synopsis: Police responded to a domestic violence incident involving an off-duty Inglewood school police officer. The off-duty officer and his girlfriend were arrested. The officer's off-duty weapon was secured along with his identification and badge.
properties.injuries: Bruises, cuts, and O. C. Spray

properties.synopsis: One male Hispanic and two female Hispanics drove up to the victim, who was standing in front of this location. The male suspect asked the victim, "Where are you from?" The male suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and struck the victim in his foot.

Driver going southbound on Hayvenhurst Avenue when he lost control of his vehicle and drifted into northbound traffic. The passenger's side of vehicle was hit by a northbound vehicle. Driver of the southbound vehicle was taken to a hospital where he was pronounced dead. The driver and his son in the northbound vehicle were taken to a hospital with minor injuries.

A female pedestrian was crossing Frank Modugno Drive, westbound from the southeast corner when she was hit by a driver of a 2004 Chevrolet Silverado pickup. Driver stopped and call 911. Pedestrian died at the hospital.
properties.address: Frank Modugno and Village Way drives

properties.synopsis: Vehicle was travelling at a high rate of speed northbound on Wentworth Street when he lost control of his motorcycle and hit a guard rail. He was pronounced dead at scene by LAFD. No evidence of street racing. Motorcyclist did not have a motorcycle license.
properties.address: Wentworth Street and Shadow Hills Avenue

properties.synopsis: Driver of a 1998 Plymouth was going eastbound on Plummer Street when vehicle collided with the left side of a 2001 Saturn being driven northbound on Encino Avenue. The impact caused the Plymouth to travel in a northeast direction where it hit a light standard. The Plymouth's driver was taken to a hospital where he died. A passenger in the Plymouth was in critical condition at a hospital. The driver of the Saturn was taken to the hospital with various injuries. Early investigation indicated that the driver of the Plymouth didn't yield right-of-way to the driver of the Saturn.
The driver of a 2003 Isuzu was going southbound on Fallbrook Avenue when he collided with a pedestrian who was walking westbound and mid-block across the street. The pedestrian died at a hospital.

A male driving a Ford Crown Victoria westbound on Rinaldi Street was east of Wilbur Avenue when he hit a parked Honda Odyssey before crashing into a tree. The 55-year-old driver from North Hills was not wearing a seat belt. He died at the scene.
properties.address: Rinaldi Street and east of Wilbur Avenue

properties.synopsis: One vehicle made a left turn in front of a second vehicle. The second vehicle collided with the first vehicle.  The second vehicle lost control and collided with a third vehicle. The person in the first vehicle died at the scene and a child in the second vehicle was ejected and died at the scene. The person in the third vehicle is the wife of a Los Angeles Police Department Northeast Division officer. Four others were taken to hospitals. hospitals and listed from critical to stable condition.

The first vehicle was north on Haskell and made a left turn to an alley south of Plummer. He collided with a second vehicle that was south on Haskell. The second vehicle continued in a south west direction, accelerating and colliding with a third vehicle that was north on Haskell. The second vehicle continued southwest, spinning, and causing the rear passenger to be ejected.

Driver of a Toyota Scion was northbound on Tampa Avenue and collided with the left rear panel of the driver of a Ford Windstar. The impact caused the Toyota Scion to go in a northwest direction and collide with the left side of a driver in a Toyota Camry going southbound on Tampa Avenue. The Toyota Scion continued in a northbound direction and collided into the front of a Toyota Corolla that was going southbound on Tampa Avenue. A passenger in the Toytoa Scion died at the scene and the driver, taken to a hospital, died later. The three other drivers were taken to area hospitals in stable condition. Witnesses said that the driver of the Scion was speeding.

One driver was eastbound on Victory Boulevard, ran a red light and collided with a driver making a left turn to go southbound on Hazeltine Avenue. The eastbound driver was taken to Valley Presbyterian Hospital and pronounced dead at 8:05 p.m.

A driver of a 2008 Ford truck was traveling northbound on Corbin Avenue when he collided with a pedestrian crossing mid-block Corbin Avenue westbound from the east curb. Pedestrian was taken to a hospital where he died from his injuries.

Pedestrian was crossing at marked crosswalk eastbound on San Fernando Mission Road at Haskell Avenue when she was struck by vehicle negotiating a southbound turn from San Fernando Mission Road.  Pedestrian was unresponsive at scene and was pronounced dead at the hospital.
properties.address: Haskell Avenue and San Fernando Mission Road

properties.synopsis: The driver of a 2005 Chevrolet pick-up truck was attempting a left turn from a northbound lane to private address. Pick-up truck was hit by a 2002 Suzuki motorcycle going southbound. The motorcyclist was pronounced dead at a hospital.
properties.address: Laurel Canyon Boulevard and Fox Street

properties.synopsis: One vehicle was westbound on Van Nuys, struck a pedestrian, who was outside of unmarked crosswalk on El Dorado. The pedestrian died at a hospital.
properties.address: Van Nuys Boulevard and El Dorado Avenue

properties.synopsis: Vehicle one was speeding north Van Nuys when he collided with the rear of a parked car with a passenger. The impact caused the parked car hit by the first vehicle to continue north and collide with the rear of another parked car on Van Nuys. The victim was taken to Holy Cross Hospital with abdominal pain, bruising to the chest and a cut to the forehead. He was pronounced dead on Oct. 3, 2008.
properties.address: Van Nuys Boulevard and Saticoy Street

properties.synopsis: The driver of a 1990 Honda was turning left from northbound Sepulveda Boulevard into the southbound number one lane of San Fernando Road and collided head-on with a 1997 Chevrolet. The impact caused the Chevrolet to overturn. The Honda's driver was not wearing a seat belt and later died at a hospital. The driver of the Chevrolet was not injured. Both drivers were unlicensed.
properties.address: Sepulveda Boulevard and San Fernando Road

properties.synopsis: A 22-year-old was speeding south on Arleta near Roscoe when he lost control of his vehicle, hitting several trees and a light post. After hitting the post, he was ejected from the vehicle. The person was taken to Pacific Hospital where he died. Alcohol was a factor. The location of the collision was in front of Polytechnic High School. The vehicle involved was a 1994 Volkswagen Jetta.

Party one was driving a vehicle west on Victory and collided with the front of a second vehicle. A second person driving that vehicle east on Victory negotiating a left turn to northbound White Oak Avenue. The first person in the first car continued northwest and collided with the left side of a third vehicle that was stopped in the southbound lanes of the White Oak Avenue. The second person was transported to Northridge Hospital and died at 10 p.m.
properties.address: Victory Boulevard and White Oak Avenue

properties.synopsis: The driver of a 2004 Chevrolet Impala was westbound on Osborne Street when, due to wet road, vehicle spun and went into oncoming traffic where it collided with a 2005 Nissan Frontier going eastbound. The driver of the first vehicle was taken to a hospital in critical condition. The front passenger in the Impala was dead at the scene. A female infant was air-lifted to hospital in critical condition. The driver of the Frontier had moderate injuries.
Suspect(s) removed property from an office safe. No evidence of forced entry to location.
Victim reported that between 11/14/08 and 11/20/08 a safe was pried open and property removed.

Victim was leaning into her parked vehicle in her apartment parking lot. The suspect approached, put a box cutter to her throat and tied her hands behind her back with a cloth. The suspect forced the victim into her vehicle. Suspect drove away but victim managed to untie her hands and jumped out of the vehicle after it had left the parking lot. Victim had minor cuts to her forehead. Victim's car and cell phone were stolen.
Unknown suspect(s) broke the window of the victim's vehicle and scrawled "Fxxx Armenia" on the truck. The victim is of Armenian descent and the vehicle had an Armenian flag decal on the windshield.
Unknown suspect(s) spray painted a wall with racial slur.
Suspect(s) smashed a headlamp and spray painted a slur on the passenger's side door of the victim's vehicle.
The victim was taking family photos at above location when suspect approached, made racial comments toward the victim and then punched the victim in the forehead. The suspect ran away.
The suspect approached the victim and said that he was not welcome in his "barrio." The victim fled.
properties.address: White Oak Avenue and Saticoy Street

properties.synopsis: The victim, a black male, was in front of a pawn shop when the suspect, an Asian male, asked him for money. The suspect called the victim a name when the victim refused to give money.
properties.address: Roscoe Boulevard and De Soto Avenue

properties.synopsis: Victim and suspect were involved in a verbal dispute after the victim yelled derogatory comments toward a clerk inside the Ralph's market at the location. The suspect, who was a bystander inside the store, observed the victim yelling at the clerk and started to yell derogatory comments at the victim. Victim claimed a slap by the suspect. Witnesses said it was only a verbal dispute.

Woman, female black, was walking to a store near her residence when the four suspects, one male and three female Hispanics, walked up behind her and called her an ethnic slur. The victim laughed and attempted to walk away. The male suspect punched the victim twice in the face.
properties.address: Sherman Way and De Soto Avenue

properties.synopsis: Suspect(s) scratched two swastikas into the paint of the victim's vehicle. Victim is Jewish but is not having any disputes.
Suspect(s) scratched a swastika on the victim's vehicle. Victim is Jewish but doesn't have anything on his vehicle to indicate his religion.

A man was walking down the street when the suspects stopped their car next to him, got out with screwdrivers and surrounded him. The suspects yelled out "nxxxxx killers." Someone else yelled out to the suspects at which time the suspects took off. Police were unable to locate the victim.

The victim and the suspect argued over a parking space. The suspect told the victim, "I hate all Armenians. I'm going to kill all of you. I'm going to get my gun." The suspect fled the scene and did not return.

Someone vandalized four separate residences with swastikas and the words “GAY,” “Russian (unable to decipher)” and “187.” A parked vehicle and the sidewalk were vandalized as well, making the city the fifth victim.
An unknown suspect wrote/etched profanities and swastikas into the accumulated dirt on the victim's vehicle, damaging the paint. The victim believes he was targeted because he is Jewish.
Someone marked on the victim’s wall with a racial epithet in addition to “from LST” (Langdon Street).

Victim is a student at a Jewish high school and had been receiving crank calls. Between 11/7 and 11/8, victim saw that his car had been egged inside and out. Victim received a cell phone message that said, "Palestinian invaders" and derogatory statements including one that said the suspects had egged victim's car.
Unknown suspect(s) spray painted racial epithets on victim’s vehicle. Victim is African American. There were no surveillance cameras and no follow up info.
Unknown suspects broke windows to a Korean church and spray painted swastikas and obscenities on the walls.
The owner of a clothing store reported that unknown suspects etched a swastika symbol on the glass door.
Someone scratched “Death to Israel” on the front door of a Jewish resident at a condominium complex.
Someone wrote derogatory comments on the cement walkway of the business.
Someone scribbled swastikas on mailboxes and a vehicle window in front of the home of Jewish residents.

Someone etched a swastika into the victim’s vehicle windshield. The victim is of Hispanic descent and has no idea why someone would target his vehicle. The incident occurred sometime between midnight on July 1 and 5 a.m. July 2.
Someone spray painted profanity regarding the church on the walls and doors.
A juvenile neighbor, of an interracial couple, threw body parts of a doll onto victims' front porch. The body parts had racial slurs written on them. Officers spoke with parents.

Two suspects approached the victim as he was standing in the street near his residence. The suspects yelled a racial epithet. The victim, in fear for his safety, took off leaving his property behind. The suspects took the victim’s property and disappeared.
Someone wrote ethnic profanities into the accumulated dirt on the victim's vehicle. The victim believes she was targeted because she is Jewish and African American.
The victim saw a rope with a noose tied to the tree in front of her residence. The victim said she has had an ongoing problem with the Hispanic gang members in the area.

The suspect entered the victim's residence pointing a gun and holding knives. The suspects, described as a male black and two male Hispanics, ordered the victims to the floor and ransacked the house. The suspect fled with property and caused about $300 in damage.
Victim was at home with her 23-year-old son while her husband and younger son went to church. During this time, the eldest son killed his mother. The suspect was arrested.
Officers responded to a call and discovered the victim with a gunshot wound to the chest. Victim was pronounced dead at a hospital
Officers responded to a drive-by shooting. Three males attempted to carjack a vehicle, were confronted by the victim, who was shot and killed.
properties.address: El Dorado Avenue and Paxton Street

properties.synopsis: Suspects pulled up in a gray Camry and fired several rounds, hitting the victim several times, including a gunshot to the head. Victim died at a hospital.

Victim was driving on Bassett Street when a vehicle pulled up and suspect(s) shot at vehicle three-four times. One round hit the victim in the head. Friends drove victim to hospital where victim was pronounced dead.
Officers responded to a call and found the victim with a gunshot wound and head injury. Victim died at the location.
The victim, tentatively identified as a 16-year-old gang member, had been shot in the head as he was riding his bicycle. He was taken to a local hospital where he died.
The victim was discovered in a parking lot, covered in blood. Firefighters pronounced the victim dead at the scene.
