Police received a call of a possible murder victim in a car. Police found the victim in a vehicle with a gunshot wound. He was pronounced dead at the scene. The suspect was identified and arrested for murder.

Suspect shot three victims in a residence. One victim, shot in the head, died at the location. One victim was shot in the chest and taken to a hospital. Third victim was taken to a hospital by a friend.

Victim was riding a bike when the suspect approached on foot. The suspect pushed the victim off the bike, fired several shots at the victim and fled the location. Victim died of gunshot wound to the head at the scene.

Officers responded to the above location for a 911 call of a victim lying on the ground bleeding from the head. The victim was pronounced dead at the scene. Devonshire homicide is conducting the investigation.
Officers responded to a shots fired call and discovered a male Hispanic with a gunshot wound. The victim was declared dead at the scene. A suspect was subsequently arrested.
Victim was shot several times and died at a hospital.
Two male suspects approached two victims. Suspects shot victims multiple times resulting in the death of one and one critical wounding.

The victim, walking with three other males, passed the suspect who was at an ATM. There was an argument, the suspect retrieved a gun from his vehicle and shot the victim. The suspect fled with a female.
properties.address: Laurel Canyon Boulevard and Vanowen Street

properties.synopsis: Officers responded to a call of shots fired. A male victim, approximately 30 years old, was found with gunshot wounds. Victim was unconscious and not breathing when an ambulance arrived. Victim was dead at the location.
properties.injuries: Yes; gunshots wounds to head and back

properties.synopsis: Officers found three gunshot victims when they arrived at the location. One victim was dead. Two victims were taken to a hospital. One victim was not hit.
Suspects drove past two male pedestrians and used an assault rifle to shoot one. One victim died at the scene.

Suspect came to victim's residence and forced entrance to front door. Suspect jumped on and attempted to harm victim. Victim's son, who was inside at the time, called the police and got suspect off of his mother. Suspect was arrested.
Victim observed suspect attempting to pry open her door and unlock it by reaching through her dog door to enter her residence. Suspect was booked for burglary.

The suspect (a former girlfriend of victim) contacted victim by text, telling him that she was going to break into his residence. Suspect entered the location through an unlocked sliding door and was confronted by victim and current girlfriend. Suspect fled with victim's property.

Victim and suspect had a prior dating relationship. The victim was at a club when the suspect showed up and told her that she didn't belong there. The suspect forced her into his vehicle, took away her cell phone and drove her to an area in Olympic Division. The victim attempted to jump out of the vehicle. Eventually the victim was able to break free and contact the police.

The victim stopped for a stop sign and the suspects entered his unlocked vehicle. The suspects ordered the victim to drive to a remote location. The suspects threatened the victim with knives and demanded property. The suspects stole the vehicle and the victim's cell phone.

Victim told officers that he drives a car for hire. He received a request to pick up a fare at 8434 Willis Avenue. The victim went to the location and picked up the suspects. The suspects had the victim drive to Lanark Street and Cabrito Road, where they pulled a knife on the victim, placed a type of string around his head and forced him into the backseat. The victim was able to escape from the vehicle. The suspects were arrested just outside of Bakersfield.

The victim’s daughter reported the crime. The victim would not report the crime because the stress from the incident required her to be hospitalized. As a result, there was a delay in the reporting of the crime. One suspect approached the victim on foot and engaged her in a conversation. The second suspect approached a vehicle. The victim was offered a ride in the vehicle. When the victim declined the ride, she was forced into the vehicle and taken to a Bank of America. The victim was told by the suspects to withdraw $12,000 from the bank. The victim went into the bank alone and was only able to withdraw $6,000. The victim returned to the suspect’s vehicle and they took the money from her. The victim was taken to Washington Mutual Bank and withdrew another $6,000, and the suspects took it. The suspects drove the victim to Rite Aide and directed her to get medication. Once the victim exited the store, the suspects were gone.

The victim, a manager of a restaurant, was driving to the bank when two male blacks in a vehicle stopped in front of the victims’s vehicle. The passenger suspect got out of the vehicle and entered the victim’s vehicle armed with a handgun. The suspect forced the victim to drive to another location where the suspect struck the victim in the face and fled with $12,000 in cash.

Suspect was observed forcing a woman into his car and driving away. Victim was fighting & struggling to break free from suspect, and yelling for help. Officers and airship canvassed the area with negative results. This incident does not appear to be related to above due to distance and suspect/victim description.

Suspect and victim have a child together, but are no longer in a relationship.  On above date & time, victim was walking home when suspect drove up and exited his car. Suspect punched victim and forced her into his car. At one point suspect threatened victim with a gun. When suspect stopped at a red light, victim was able to flee, and notify police. Suspect is still outstanding.

A man allegedly shot his estranged wife and kidnapped their 3- and 5- year-old sons. Jose Luis Ortega, 27, allegedly shot his wife as many as a dozen times around 10:45 a.m. Sunday when they got into an argument as she was dropping off their sons at his home in the 10400 block of McBroom Street in Shadow Hills near Hansen Dam. He fled with the boys in a 1998 black Ford Ranger pickup truck that was found about 11:10 p.m. Sunday at 110th Street East and Avenue J-8 in Lancaster. His wife, who is in her 20s, was hospitalized in critical condition. An Amber Alert was issued for the boys -- 3-year-old Luis Gonzalo Ortega and 5-year-old Diego Fabian Ortega -- but it was canceled after the suspect's vehicle was found.

Victim and suspect had a dating relationship for three years but never lived together. Victim met suspect for a property exchange at this location. Suspect began beating victim and ordered her into his vehicle. Out of fear, victim complied. Suspect drove to his residence and continued beating the victim. Victim fled residence, went to neighbors, who refused to help her. Victim flagged down an officer driving by the location. Suspect was arrested.

A woman told police she was kidnapped at an Albertson's grocery store. She told authorities her abductor had a gun and drove her around in her car for several hours before stopping near where she was taken and getting got out and fleeing. He was described only as a male Hispanic with a bald head, a tattoo of a Latin or a Latino on his stomach and a possible cut to his left wrist. The victim was not sexually assaulted.

Suspect (victim's 31-year old son) came to the residence and asked for money. When victim advised suspect he had none, suspect dragged victim from the front door into the victim's bedroom. Suspect then pushed victim down and sat on top of him. Suspect eventually fled the location after he was unable to locate any money.

Suspect (victim's boyfriend) dragged victim into his vehicle by her hair after an argument.  As the suspect drove around the area, the victim was able to escape.  The suspect was taken into custody without incident.  Victim was not injured.

The victim alleged that an unknown suspect approached him and demanded money while pointing a handgun at him.  The victim stated he had no money so the suspect attempted to force him into his residence. The victim told the suspect his wife would be home soon. The suspect ordered the victim into his vehicle and told him to drive to Lindley Avenue and Parthenia Street. There, the suspect took the victim's sunglasses and additional property prior to getting out of the victim's vehicle.

The victim said he was in a drunken argument with the suspect when the suspect stabbed him in the arm with a switchblade knife. The victim was transported to the hospital and admitted for two stab wounds to his arm. The victim was listed in stable condition.

Officers handled a mauling investigation at the above location. Upon their arrival, they were met by LAFD. Two pit bulls were inside the yard, preventing them from entering the location. Fire Department personnel utilized their fire extinguisher and contained the dogs in the back yard. A 2-year old child had been bitten in the face. Officers ensured that the location was clear of all persons and contained the dogs in the back yard. Animal Control arrived and removed the dogs without incident. The child was air lifted to Children’s Hospital for serious but not life-threatening injuries to his face. An injury report was completed.
The 14 year-old girl was reported missing. She was subsequently located at her boyfriend’s residence and reunited with her parents at the Van Nuys police station.

Missing was a 60 year-old black woman who was diagnosed with cancer and early stages of Alzheimer’s disease. She was last seen in her residence by family members. There was no evidence of foul play inside the residence.  Police conducted a search for with negative results. A running log was established and periodic checks were conducted.

properties.city: Studio City, Valley Village and North Hollywood
properties.synopsis: Suspects threatened clerks at each gas station and stole money.
properties.address: 3870 Cahuenga Blvd., 5158 Laurel Canyon Blvd. and Sherman Way and Whitsett Avenue

properties.synopsis: An LAPD officer accidentally fired her gun last night while she tried to stop suspects during an undercover sting in Sun Valley, police said today. Nobody was hurt during the 6:30 p.m. incident Monday in the 9000 block of Telfair Avenue. It happened when an undercover unit targeting violent offenders called in uniformed patrol officers to make a stop on the vehicle. Police said the vehicle, which contained two people considered armed and dangerous, pulled into a driveway. Officer Claudia Avila and her partner pulled up behind them, got out of their squad car and "drew their weapons to conduct a high-risk stop," police said. "While holding her duty weapon with her right hand, Officer Avila attempted to put the vehicle in park with her left hand and accidentally discharged her weapon," a police statement said. Both suspects were taken into custody for a crime unrelated to the accidental shooting, according to the LAPD. Their names were not immediately available. An internal police investigation will be launched into the incident, police said. Avila has been with the department for two years and one month, police said.

Police got into a pursuit and a gunbattle with three gangsters in a stolen 2007 Nissan Altima with dealer paper license plates. The pursuit ended when the Altima crashed into a curb at Clybourn Avenue and San Fernando Road. While police chased one of the suspects, another fired at them from behind a parked truck. More gunfire was exchanged but the suspect eventually dropped his gun and gave up. Police arrested three suspects and recovered a 9 mm Browning pistol. One of the suspects was hit in the left knee. Two suspects were on parole and were documented Vineland Boys gang members. No officer was injured.
properties.address: De Garmo Avenue and Arminta Street

properties.synopsis: An alleged drunken driver was in custody today after leading police on a pursuit that ended with an officer-involved shooting near the Pacoima area, but no one was hurt by the gunfire, authorities said. The incident began at Van Nuys and Laurel Canyon boulevards just before 10 p.m. Thursday, when a motorcycle officer from the Los Angeles Police Department's Valley Traffic Division began following a man in a Honda Civic who appeared to be intoxicated, Captain Mark Olvera of the LAPD's Valley Traffic Division said. The officer tried to make a traffic stop, but the driver refused to yield, triggering a chase, Olvera said, adding that the motor officer then requested backup, and a patrol unit from the LAPD's Foothill Station joined in the pursuit. The chase ended at Paxton Street and Foothill Boulevard, when the man began driving in the wrong direction, struck a curb and then drove toward the officer on the motorcycle, Olvera said. "The officer felt threatened and fired two rounds" toward the suspect vehicle, striking the car's hood and windshield, he said, adding that the driver was not hit by the gunfire. Police then took the man into custody, and he was transported to a hospital for complaints of neck pain -- injuries suffered when he struck the curb, Olvera said. After being checked out at the hospital, the suspect was booked for drunk driving, Olvera said. His name was not immediately released. No officers were injured during the chase, he added. Police were investigating whether the suspect was involved in any other possible traffic accidents during the pursuit, Olvera said.

Police responded to a possible kidnap radio call involving a possible female student approximately 10-11 years of age. There was no kidnapping. The possible victim was located safe at the home of her uncle in Van Nuys Division.

Picketers - PETA, the animal rights group, were outside of a Kentucky Fried Chicken protesting the treatment of chickens. There were 20 protesters, two adults and 18 pre-teens, who were peaceful but blocking the sidewalk.  A unit and supervisor responded to the scene, met with the organizer, explained the laws and monitored their activity. The group was cooperative and ended their activities at 1900 hours.

Victim was inside her residence when she heard noises in her back yard.Victim looked out and saw a male in dark clothing and wearing a black ski mask. Victim screamed at the suspect telling him she was calling the police. Suspect climbed over the rear wall and fled in an unknown direction.

Driver committed several traffic violations and officers attempted a traffic stop. Driver attempted to flee and officers followed until driver lost control and crashed the vehicle. Driver fled on foot, pursued by both officers and a police dog. Police dog bit suspect. Suspect was arrested.
properties.address: Strathern Street, west of Mason Avenue

properties.synopsis: Officers went in a short pursuit of a suspected DUI driver. The pursuit ended without incident when the suspect pulled over.

Officers observed a stolen vehicle at Lankershim Boulevard and Telfair Avenue. They followed but suspect refused to pull over and a pursuit began. The suspect drove to Ventura County and the California Highway took over the pursuit. The CHP officers used a tire deflation device to stop the vehicle and the suspect was arrested.

Officer was conducting a traffic stop when the suspect sped off, recklessly, resulting in a short pursuit. The suspect fled on foot. Stolen property was observed in the vehicle. The suspect was found and arrested.
Suspect committed an assault with a deadly weapon and refused to stop for officers. A three hour pursuit ended when the suspect stopped his vehicle and committed suicide.

Officers observed a vehicle on Balboa at Sesnon and attempted to conduct a stop. The driver fled and a pursuit ensued. The pursuit lasted only a couple of minutes due to the officers losing the vehicle. Approximately 25 minutes later, the officers responded to a stolen car call. The investigation found that the suspect had parked the stolen vehicle in the garage of a house located at 9357 Texhoma Ave. He ran to a residence at 17639 Prairie St. and confronted a citizen who was outside his house picking up his morning newspaper. The suspect used a gun and fled in the victim's car.

Officers detained a suspect on suspicious activity and verified that the suspect had an outstanding misdemeanor warrant. The suspect, trying to escape, struck one officer who received a blow to the knee. The suspect fled the located but later turned himself into the station.

Suspects approached victim from behind. One suspect pointed a gun and stated in Spanish, "Give me your money," and then struck the victim on the right side of the head with the weapon. The victim took out his wallet and $1,700 from his pocket and threw it under his vehicle. The second suspect went inside the vehicle and took a pair of binoculars. Suspects fled on foot.

Victim was walking and talking on cell phone when suspects approached him in a mid-2000 Saturn. One suspect exited the car and confronted the victim. Suspect demanded the cell phone which the victim handed over. Suspect then produced the firearm and demanded victim's wallet which victim handed over. Suspect fled in car,

Two men, one described as Latino the other black, went into a World Savings Real Estate Loan Division and ordered the employees into the storage room before taking cash from the register and running away. No weapon was seen. Detectives determined that this was not related to a robbery the previous day.

The victim was leaving his office when two male Hispanic suspects approached him. One suspect grabbed the victim's briefcase, while the second suspect pointed a revolver at him. The victim, in fear, complied with the suspects' demand to "Just let it go." The suspects then took off in an awaiting vehicle with two other suspects inside.

The victim was walking when one suspect approached. The suspect asked the victim whether he spoke English or Spanish. When the victim told him that he spoke both languages, the suspect asked him for directions, pulled a pistol from his waistband and aimed it at the victim. The suspect told the victim to give him his iPOD or he would shoot. The suspect fled into a waiting vehicle.

Victim claimed to be from out of town and staying at the location. Two suspects forced their way into the location and began shooting at the victims. Suspects took a large amount of money and an unknown number of buckets containing marijuana before fleeing.
Suspect, armed with a pistol and wearing a skeleton mask, demanded money from the owner of the restaurant. The owner gave the money to the suspect and fled the location.
Suspect approached a delivery driver, pointed a gun and demanded the pizza, money and victim's cell phone. Suspect fled into a complex at the location.

The victim recognized a person she knew who was in a vehicle. The victim talked with the passenger and became involved in a dispute with the driver. The suspect got out of the vehicle and attempted to punch the victim. The suspect and victim began fighting. One suspect attempted to hold the victim during the fight. One suspect stole the victim's purse. The victim fled to a store to get away from the suspects.

Two white female suspects, between the ages of 18 and 20, approached a female victim who was walking home from work. The suspects punched the victim and pulled her purse away from her. The suspects then got into a vehicle driven by a male suspect and fled the scene.

Someone smashed the victim’s passenger-side window, reached into the vehicle and patted the victim’s waistband area, while simulating a gun in his waistband. The suspect took the victim’s property while a second suspect stood by.
The suspects approached the news stand on foot and demanded money from the clerk. One suspect pulled out a pistol. The clerk complied and suspects fled on foot.

The suspect, described only as a male Hispanic, walked into the liquor store, pulled out a blue-steel revolver and removed an unknown amount of currency from the cash register. A description of the suspect was not available.
A suspect entered a restaurant, displayed a gun, then gave the clerk a note which read, “I have a gun, give me the money.” The clerk complied.
Three family members, with a tow truck business, went to the location to tow a vehicle. Two suspects, one armed with the pistol, robbed the three of property. Suspects fled on foot.

Suspects approached the victim. One suspect pointed a pistol and said, "Give me your money or I will kill you." The suspect then hit the victim in the head. Suspects took victim's wallet and fled in a black SUV.
A suspect entered a business and stated, “Do me a favor, and put the money in the bag.” The employee complied and the suspect fled.

The victim, a street vendor, was robbed by three male Hispanics driving a blue mini-van, possibly a Chevrolet Astro. The van pulled up to the victim and one suspect asked the price of fruit. The front seat passenger partially opened the door and the victim could see the suspect was holding a shotgun. One suspect demanded money. The victim said he didn't have any. One suspect pulled the wristwatch from the victim's arm and the suspects fled the location.

Two black male suspects entered the bank pointing pistols. One suspect remained by the door while the other jumped the counter. Customers were ordered to the floor. The registers were emptied and one customer's purse was taken. Suspects fled in a newer model Lexus.No shots fired.

One suspect entered the business and produced the pistol from his waistband and demanded money from the cashier. A second suspect waited outside as a lookout. The suspect inside grabbed about $45 when the cashier opened the register. Suspects left in a dark-colored Chevrolet pick-up truck.

One victim was sitting inside his vehicle talking with second victim, who was standing outside of the vehicle. Two suspects approached on foot.  One suspect produced a knife and placed it on the second victim’s back while suspect two raised his shirt and brandished a handgun in his waistband. One suspect demanded money and the victim in the car, in fear, gave the first suspect his wallet. Both suspects fled on foot from the location.

Suspects approached victim on foot and brandished a pistol and taser.  Suspect's demanded victim's property. Victim complied. Victim then grabbed the air soft pistol away from suspect one. Both suspects fled. Victim pursued suspects on foot and then in a vehicle, but eventually lost sight of the suspects. The pistol was booked as evidence.

The suspect, wearing a Halloween mask, entered the business. Suspect pointed a pistol at the clerk and demanded money from the register. Clerk put money in the suspect's backpack. Suspect fled the location on foot.

A female employee of Copart Auto Salvage was robbed of approximately $20,000 (cash), by a suspect armed with a knife, as she returned from her daily routine of cashing checks. The suspect fled in a two-door compact, southbound from the location.

A gunman confronted the manager of the store as he was unlocking the doors of the store for the start of the business day. The suspect walked the manager to the store safe and forced him to hand over the contents before taking off with money. No vehicle was seen.

Victim parked in underground garage after returning from work. Suspect struck victim in face with fists and kicked him when he fell to the ground. suspects removed money and jewelry from the victim. Suspects fled on foot.

The victim was talking on the cell phone when the suspect approached him from behind. The suspect placed a blunt object (possible handgun) against the victim's neck and demanded his cell phone and money. The suspect took the property and fled on foot, pursued by the victim. The victim lost sight of the suspect. A short time later, the victim observed the suspect in the area and chased him on foot. The victim again lost sight of the suspect. The victim's phone was pinged with negative results.

Suspects, armed with pistols, used a ruse to enter victims' residence. Once inside, suspects proceeded to rob victims of cash, laptops, and I-phones. Victims were able to flee from the location and call the police.  Two suspects were apprehended, fleeing from the location. The third suspect fled the location in a vehicle and was subsequently apprehended.
Suspect approached the victim from behind as the victim was leaving his vehicle. The suspect held a knife at the victim's back and demanded money. The victim complied and suspect fled on foot.
Suspect removed victim's property from his vehicle without permission. Witness notified victim who chased after suspects. Suspect, one, produced a pistol and fled southbound Lankershim Blvd.

Suspects approached victim outside her apartment and asked her for money. Victim gave suspects $10, at which time they asked her for some water. Victim invited suspects to her apartment to get water. As victim opened the door, suspects pushed her in, brandished a knife and told her not to move.  Suspects took jewelry and fled.
Suspects approached the victim from behind and stuck an unknown object in his back and said, "Don't move or I will smoke you." Suspects removed victim's cell phone and $20 from pockets.

Two suspects, wearing black hooded sweatshirts, approached the victim as he was talking on his cell phone. One suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and grabbed his phone. Suspects fled eastbound on Hubbard Street.
properties.address: Hubbard Street and Laurel Canyon Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Suspect entered the bank inside of a grocery store. Suspect passed a note that said, "Give me all your money." The teller complied. Suspect fled on foot.
Suspect asked the victim for the time. While victim was distracted, the suspect produced a pistol and demanded money. The victim gave the suspect $26. Suspect fled the location on foot.
The “Food Note Bandits” took money from the location.

The Suspect approached the Victim when he arrived at the delivery location and was still in his car. The Suspect took out his wallet as if to pay for the pizza. A female Suspect entered the back seat of the Victim's car and pressed an unknown hard object into the victim's back. The Victim was robbed of the pizza, cash, and his cell phone. Both Suspects then fled on foot.

Two males approached a lone female from behind. One suspect grabbed her purse and attempted to pull it away. When the victim pulled on her purse to retain it, the second suspect punched her in the face. Victim released her purse and the suspects fled on foot.

Three armed male suspects entered a business and ordered employees to the ground. The suspects removed wallets from the employees and removed property from the facility. Suspects fled out the rear door and ran westbound in the alley.
The “Food Note Bandits” took money from the location.
A male Hispanic suspect entered a business armed with a pistol. The suspect obtained money and fled east on foot. No injuries were reported.

A suspect entered a catering truck and ordered the victim to the ground. The suspect took the victim’s wallet then entered the suspect’s vehicle which was driven by a second suspect. Both suspects were possibly patrons that had eaten at the catering truck approximately 15 minutes prior to the crime.

The victim had just parked his vehicle behind suspect’s vehicle when four male Hispanics got out of the vehicle. One suspect approached the passenger side of the victim’s vehicle and pointed an unknown-type gun (possibly a toy) at the victim through the open passenger window and pulled the trigger twice. The second suspect reached into the open driver’s window and took the victim’s cell phone. The third and fourth suspects stood by. The victim drove away out of fear for his life.

The suspects entered the store and took two bottles of wine from the shelf. When the victim confronted the suspects, one suspect brandished a knife at the victim. The suspects fled with the stolen property.

Victims were parked in front of a business. One suspect approached one victim, who was outside of the vehicle. Suspect produced a pistol and demanded property. The second suspect approached the driver's side and physically removed two victims and forced them to the ground. The suspects removed the victims' property and fled.

The suspect entered the victim’s business and approached the front counter. The suspect, who was wearing a hooded sweatshirt, covered most of his face. He pulled out a black pistol from his pants pocket demanded money. The suspect then walked behind the counter and removed money from a cash drawer that had fallen on the floor and fled the location.

Suspect approached victim and asked for directions. One suspect placed the pistol to the stomach of the victim and demanded the victim's property. The second suspect told the victim to turn around as the first suspect put the pistol at the back of the victim's head. One suspect removed victim's property. Suspects got into an early 1990s four-door Honda and left going northbound on Haskell Avenue.
properties.address: Haskell Avenue between Saticoy Street and Strathern Street

properties.synopsis: Suspect approached victim and offered to give her a ride. Victim declines. Suspect approached on foot and showed victim a pistol in his waistband. Suspect removed victim's necklace and property from her purse. Suspect fled in an older, white pick-up with a white/black shell.
Suspect smashed the kitchen door window and entered the residence. Suspect stole jewelry and left by the kitchen door. The suspect activated surveillance footage, capturing the burglary in progress.

The victim was walking home when he observed three black male youths pass him by on the sidewalk. As the victim entered his driveway, one suspect grabbed him from behind and covered the victim’s mouth with his hand. The second suspect grabbed the victim’s arm, while the third suspect removed the victim’s wallet from his pants pocket. As the victim struggled with the suspects, they all fell to the ground, where the victim sustained some minor abrasions. The suspects fled location on foot with Victim’s property.

Officers, while driving west on Ventura Boulevard witnessed what appeared to be a fist fight. Officers conducted a U-turn and heard a woman yell, "They just took my purse!" The officers were able to apprehend and take five suspects into custody at gunpoint. The investigation revealed that five suspects approached two victims in an attempt to rob them. The suspects started beating on the victims and ultimately took the purse.  A witness observed one of the suspects hit the male victim in the head with the gun. A K-9 unit responded and conducted an article search where they located a black steel air gun. There were no visible injuries and the victim did not request medical treatment. A field show up was conducted and all five suspects were identified, including one of them as having the gun and one as having taken the purse.
properties.address: Ventura Boulevard and Blue Canyon Drive

properties.synopsis: The gunman displayed a chrome semi-auto handgun, still secured in his waistband, and demanded money from the victim. The victim complied and gave the suspect $90. The suspect thanked the victim and ran away.
The victim was sleeping in his vehicle when the suspects tapped on his window. The suspects robbed him at gun and knife point before taking off in a dark sedan with the victim’s cell phone and money.
A man armed with a shotgun cocked the gun and ordered a person to lay down. Four other suspects took the victim's property before the men ran away.

A male black suspect holding a handgun, approached two victims who were walking. The suspect demanded the victim’s purse. The victim relinquished her purse to the suspect who fled in an unknown type black vehicle driven by another male black. Attempts to ping the stolen cellular phones contained within victim’s purse were unsuccessful. This incident appears to be related to a robbery the same night at 9:30 p.m. in the 11400 block of Hayvenhurst. In that case, a female victim was loading items into her vehicle and was approached by a male black suspect holding a pistol. The victim, in fear, ran. The suspect chased the victim and removed the victim’s purse from her grasp, causing the victim to fall. The suspect took off in an unknown type black vehicle driven by another male black.
properties.address: Paso Robles and El Oro Way

properties.synopsis: A female victim was loading items into her vehicle and was approached by a male black suspect holding a pistol. The victim, in fear, ran. The suspect chased the victim and removed the victim’s purse from her grasp, causing the victim to fall. The suspect took off in an unknown type black vehicle driven by another male black. The case appears to be related to a robbery on the same night at 9:57 p.m. at Paso Robles and El Oro Way. In that case, a male black suspect holding a handgun, approached two victims who were walking. The suspect demanded the victim’s purse. The victim relinquished her purse to the suspect who fled in an unknown type black vehicle driven by another male black. Attempts to ping the stolen cellular phones contained within victim’s purse were unsuccessful.

Officers responded to a radio call of a female and a male adult in their vehicle, when a male Hispanic suspect armed with a handgun approached them and demanded property. The victims were robbed of their money. The suspect then entered an unknown type vehicle driven by another suspect and disappeared.
A suspect entered the business through the back door when an employee opened it to empty the garbage. The suspect forced the manager to open the safe and fled with the money.

The suspect, riding a red bike, approached the victim and demanded the victim’s money at knife point. The victim complied and the suspect fled on his bicycle with the victim’s money and a ring. This appears to be connected to a robbery at Lankershim and Hartsook that occurred the at 10 the night before.In that case, the suspect, riding a red bike, approached the victim and demanded the victim’s cell phone at knife point. The victim complied and the suspect fled on his bicycle with the victim’s property.
The suspect grabbed the victim’s purse and pushed her before running to a vehicle and taking off with the victim’s property.
Suspect entered the business, wearing a black ski mask and black gloves. Suspect pointed a pistol at the cashier and demanded money.

The suspect, riding a red bike, approached the victim and demanded the victim’s cell phone at knife point. The victim complied and the suspect fled on his bicycle with the victim’s property. The case appears to be connected to a robbery that occurred at 3:45 a.m. the next morning at Oxnard Street and Lankershim Boulevard. In that case, the suspect, riding a red bike, approached the victim and demanded the victim’s money at knife point. The victim complied and the suspect fled on his bicycle with the victim’s money and a ring.

The victim was arriving home when two suspects wearing bandanas over their faces approached him in his car. One suspect pointed a semi automatic pistol at the victim and demanded his property. The victim, in fear, complied. The suspect then hit the victim on the head with brass knuckles while stating “This Blythe Street.” A second suspect was also armed with a semi automatic pistol and brass knuckles. The suspects took off the neighboring apartment complexes.
Suspect used a key and entered the business. Suspect pointed a gun at the employees and demanded money from a safe. The employees gave money from two safes to the suspect.

The two victims were walking to their vehicle that was parked in the rear alley when they were approached by a suspect and a second suspect, who were in a white Chevy four-door vehicle. The second suspect - the driver - lured the victims to their vehicle by asking for directions at which time, the first suspect got out of the passenger side and approached them armed with a pistol. One victim screamed and the first suspect cocked the hammer of the gun and demanded their purses and both victims complied.
Suspect entered the business wearing a ski mask, showed the clerk a pistol and demanded money. The clerk complied and suspect fled.
Suspects approached two victims and produced a shotgun. Victims gave up their wallets and IPODs. Suspects fled the location.
properties.address: Van Nuys Boulevard and Keswick Street

properties.synopsis: The suspect entered the business and used bodily force to take money from an employee. The suspect took off in a vehicle that matched a vehicle used in previous robberies. Officers located the vehicle a short time later and arrested suspects. A robbery detectives are handling the investigation.
Suspect approached the cashier and showed a possible pistol in his waistband. Suspect demanded the money. Cashier complied. Suspect fled the location.

One suspect approached the victim and demanded the victim's gold chain. Victim refused and struck the suspect. The second suspect struck the victim in the back numerous times with a stick or a pipe. Suspects removed victim's property and continued to hit the victim. Suspects fled location. Victim told officers that he would not be able to identify suspects.
The suspect entered the business, simulated a gun and demanded money. In fear, the employee complied. The suspect took off with currency.

The suspect entered location and put a gun on the manager’s neck. The suspect stated "Give me the fxxxxxx money!" The manager, in fear, complied. The suspect ran away. He described as black with a light complexion, 6 foot 1, 180 pounds and between 25 and 30-years-old.
Suspect entered California national Bank and used a demand note to take cash. Suspect fled the location on foot.

Both victims were walking on the sidewalk when a male black and a male Hispanic approached them from behind.  One suspect pointed a pistol at the victims while the other removed property from their pockets. The suspects then fled the scene in a 1998 or 1999 black compact vehicle, with no plates. It was later discovered that prior to this robbery, both suspects had committed another robbery at Parthenia and Mason Avenue. In that robbery, the victim’s backpack was taken. Detectives are handling both robberies.
Suspect entered the store and went to the register with a candy bar. Suspect drew a pistol and demanded money. Suspect took money.
Suspect entered the business wearing a ski mask, pointed a pistol at the store clerk and demanded money. Clerk complied and suspect fled.

The suspect entered a Kentucky Fried Chicken and approached the counter as if to order. A second suspect handed the clerk a note which read, "Give us all the money, we have a gun�." One suspect lifted his shirt and displayed a gun. A second suspect then stated "All the money, don't leave anything in there�." The clerk placed the money in a paper bag, and the suspects took off. One was described as a male Latino and the other a male black.
In an alley, a male Hispanic dragged a woman on the ground, grabbed her purse and disappeared.

Three male whites, possible juveniles, entered the business armed with a pistol. One of the suspects struck the sales clerk in the face, dragged him to the back store office and tied him up. The suspects then ordered the other employee to open the cash register. One of the suspects pulled a screwdriver and jammed open the cash register. The suspects took an unknown amount of money and took off. It was unknown if the suspects fled in a vehicle or on foot.

Male suspect entered the business and told employees he had a gun. No gun was seen during the crime. The suspect took $40 and left on foot. Employees told officers that the suspect was a regular customer but they didn't know his name or where he lived.

One suspect entered the gas station and looked at food merchandise. The second suspect entered and approached the cashier behind the counter and demanded money. The suspect then hit the cashier in the head with a pistol. Both suspects fled northbound on Topanga Canyon Boulevard.

Victim was standing outside his apartment building when the suspects approached. Suspects overpowered victim and began beating him. One suspect produced a gun and demanded the victim's money. Victim told officers that he thought suspects were sent by an ex-girlfriend because of threats made by her. Victim said that ex-girlfriend asked him to stop calling her and if he didn't, she knew people who would make him stop. Victim had minor injuries.

Four male Hispanics approached victim and asked where he was from. Victim told suspects he didn't "bang" and continued walking. Suspects ran after victim, tripped him and then punched and kicked. Victim dropped his cell phone during the attack and, when he demanded it back, one suspect pointed a pistol at the victim. Officers detained possible suspects but they were not positively identified by the victim.

The victim was delivering a pizza and upon his arrival was unable to enter the complex because the gate code he was given was invalid. Three males inside the location called him over, and stated that they ordered the pizza. As one suspect was pretending to search his pockets for money, a second suspect pulled a small blue-steel semi-auto pistol. He pointed the gun at the victim’s head, and demanded the pizzas. The suspects fled on foot with the victim’s property.

Victims were parked and sitting in their vehicle in a bank parking lot. Male victim left the vehicle and was approached by a male suspect. Suspect unzipped his jacket and produced a pistol. Suspect ordered the male victim back into the vehicle. Suspect approached the passenger side and told the female victim, "Give me all your s*, I know you got s*, give it to me or I'll start shooting." Suspect then grabbed the female victim's purse and the male victim's backpack and ran northbound across Ventura Boulevard. Female victim ran after the suspect. Suspect turned around and pointed the pistol at her. Suspect jumped into a white vehicle driven by suspect two and they fled westbound Ventura Boulevard to northbound Canoga Avenue. Property taken included medical marijuana and cash.
The suspect approached the victim and placed a pistol to the victim's ribs and demanded money. Victim gave the suspect his wallet.

Suspects approached the victim from behind. The victim turned and observed the suspects. One suspect placed a pistol to victim's cheek. Victim thought the pistol was fake and pushed the suspect's hand away. The second suspect placed a pistol to the victim's chest. Suspects then removed the victim's property and fled on foot.

The suspects, armed with a pistol, approached the victim and demanded his property. The victim, in fear for his life, gave the suspects his property. The suspects fled to an unknown location with the victim’s property.

The victim was at the gas station when the suspects approached him from behind. One of the suspects pointed a gun at the victim and demanded money, while a second suspect stood by. The victim, in fear, gave the suspect his wallet that had money. The suspects took off in an unknown direction in a compact vehicle.
Suspect entered the location and produced a "simulated" pistol. Suspect fled with crash. Suspect arrested at a later date.
Two suspects got out of a black SUV and approached the victim who was walking on the sidewalk. One suspect pulled a gun and took victim’s property.

The suspect entered a local department store and requested to see a portable MP3 player.  When the employee went to open the case, the suspect lifted his shirt exposing a gun.  The suspect then took several items of electronic merchandise and ran out of the location.

The victim, walking on a sidewalk was approached by the suspect, who got out of a compact vehicle. The suspect struck the victim on the back of the head with an unknown object. The suspect then pointed a pistol at the victim and stole the victim’s purse before taking off in a vehicle driven by another male Hispanic suspect.

The victim was riding his bicycle when the suspects stopped him, surrounded him, and demanded his property. The suspects began beating the victim until he fell to the ground. The suspects took his property and fled.  Officers saw three of the four suspects and detained them. A field show-up was conducted and the three suspects were identified. The fourth was identified by the other suspects, but has not been taken into custody as of this report. The three suspects were booked for robbery. The victim received cuts and bruises as a result of the attack.
Suspects approached victim on foot. One suspect pointed a pistol at her and demanded money. Suspects fled with victim's property
Suspects approached victim on foot. One suspect pointed a pistol at victim and demanded money. Suspects fled with victim's property.

The victims, a husband and wife, had just returned home when the suspect, a male Hispanic, confronted them with a pistol. The suspect demanded the male victim’s watch and the victim, in fear, complied. The suspect struck the victim on his head with the pistol and took off with the victim’s property.

Someone smashed the victim’s vehicle window with an unknown object and removed the victim’s property. The victim observed the suspects burglarizing his vehicle and attempted to stop them. The suspects then pointed a pistol at the victim and threatened to harm the victim.

The victim was seated in her vehicle when she was approached by the suspect, armed with a handgun. The suspect pointed the gun at her and demanded her money. The suspect took the victim's property and fled.

The victim had just left a bank with currency in an envelope. As the victim entered his vehicle, the suspect, described as a male black, approached, pointed a gun at the victim and took the envelope with money from the victim. The suspect took off in unknown direction.

A unit was flagged down by pedestrian who reported that he had been robbed. The victim stated two male Hispanics approached him on foot and each pointed a handgun at him.  One of the suspects reached into the victims pockets and took his cellular telephone and his keys. The suspect then fled on foot.
Suspects approached victim on foot, produced handguns and demanded property. Suspects fled with money, a bracelet and cell phone.

Two suspects, male black, approached the female victim. One suspect had a pistol and demanded the victim's purse. Victim gave the suspect her purse. Suspects fled on foot westbound on Ventura Boulevard.

Victim was asleep in a vehicle. Suspects approached the vehicle and opened the door. Suspects punched the victim in the face and stabbed him in the arm. Suspects held the knife to victim's throat and demanded his money. Victim complied and suspects fled on foot.

The suspect got off a bus and approached the victim. The suspect pulled an 8-inch folding knife, demanded the victim’s IPod and threatened to kill the victim if he ran. The suspect then fled on foot with the victim’s property.

Victim was sleeping when two men entered his apartment. Suspects told victim to lie face down on the floor. Suspects demanded money and took $100 from victim's wallet and ransacked the apartment. Suspects fled with money and a duffle bag

Victim was attending a party at the location when suspects arrived with beer and marijuana. Suspects asked the victim where he was from and victim said he was from the 805 (area code). One suspect said that he didn't like the 805 and then struck the victim on the face with a beet bottle. Victim responded by hitting the first suspect. The other suspects entered into the fight by punching and kicking the victim. Suspects fled in multiple vehicles. Victim was treated at Northridge hospital.

Suspect approached the female victim who was in the drive-through of a Carl's Jr. restaurant. Suspect approached victim's vehicle's window, pointed a pistol and demanded the victim's purse. The victim gave the suspect her purse. Suspect fled westbound on foot through the alley.

The suspect, described as male white in his 40s entered a 76 gas station with a 24-inch knife. He walked into the cash register room and demanded that the employee open the register and give him the money. The suspect gave the employee his own bag. Once the suspect had the money, he ran away.
Suspects approached victim from behind, pointed the pistol and demanded money. Victim complied and suspects fled.

Two suspects, male Hispanics, approached victim and asked for the price of a burrito. One suspect displayed a pistol and punched the victim in the neck as victim fell to the ground. Suspects stole money and fled.

Four victims were in the home, which was being remodeled. The home owner is a jailer/prison guard at the downtown federal detention center. Allegedly, four suspects walked into his home via an open front door, two armed with handguns, two with knives. All were wearing long-sleeved shirts and gloves. They handcuffed the victims to various pieces of furniture and ransacked the home. Apparently they were stacking up electronics when one suspect located the homeowner's pistol and federal ID in the bedroom. They all then immediately fled the scene. The pistol was taken, the badge remained.

One suspect, male Hispanic, acted as a customer and followed the cashier behind the counter. Second suspect, male Hispanic, pointed a pistol at the cashier and demanded money. Suspects stole the moeny and fled in a white, four-door vehicle northbound on Coldwater Canyon Avenue.

Suspects exited a vehicle and approached the victim. One suspect hit victim with a baseball bat and a second suspect pushed victim to the ground. The second suspect kicked victim in the head until the victim lost consciousness. The third suspect stole the victim's money and cell phone.

Suspect approached the victim, who was seated on the driver's side of her parked vehicle. Suspect produced a knife and stated something to the victim that she could not comprehend. The suspect then grabbed keys out of the victim's hand. The victim tried to grab her keys back. The passenger exited vehicle to confront the suspect and then the suspect fled on foot.

Suspects knocked on door to victim's residence. One victim opened the door and suspects rushed inside. Suspects pistol-whipped two of the victims and tied up five others. Suspects ransacked the entire house, taking cash and computers. Suspects also ransacked victims' cars in the driveway. Suspects were communicating with two-way radios. Two victims had head injuries. One suspect dropped a glove.
Someone with a white bandana on his face confronted the Altadena Dairy store clerk with a broken bottle. The suspect demanded money. The clerk complied and the suspect ran away.
One suspect entered the business and pointed a gun at the cashier and demanded money. The second suspect stood outside as a look out. Suspect jumped the counter and took the money from the register.

One suspect asked the victim for a ride. The victim took one suspect to the location where the other suspects were waiting. One suspect pointed a gun at the victim's head while another suspect searched him. The suspects stole victim's cell phone, money and vehicle.

A robbery was reported yesterday at 10:45 p.m. in the 14600 block of Chase. The suspect, described as a male black in his 20s, 6-feet, 150-160 lbs, approached the victim in the parking lot and pointed a stainless steel semi-automatic pistol at the Victim. The suspect rummaged through the Victim's pockets and removed currency and jewelry before taking off in a vehicle occupied by three additional male blacks.

Suspect approached two victims on foot, pointed a pistol and said, "Give me your (expletive) money." Suspect stole $20 and a credit card from one victim and a cell phone from the second victim. Suspect fled on foot westbound on Riverside Drive.
Victim was walking on Cedros Avenue when the male suspect approached, displayed a pistol and demanded the victim's Ipod. Victim complied and suspect fled southbound.

The victim was working at a condominium complex when he came upon a pickup truck loaded with metal railings from the complex. Suddenly, four male unknown black suspects confronted him, one armed with a revolver. The suspects then robbed him of his property and demanded the keys to the condominium complex. The victim advised the suspects that he did not have the keys, at which time the suspects fled the location in their vehicle.
Suspects, both armed, kicked open victim's door. Suspects told victim to lie on the floor. Suspects stole a duffle bag, watches, video games and cash.
Suspect approached victim and asked the time. Suspect then pointed the pistol and demanded money. Suspect fled on foot but was later arrested.

Officers responded to Holy Cross Medical Center where they talked to a possible victim of a robbery. Victim said he was in the carport of his residence when several male Hispanics with shaved heads approached him. The suspects demanded property . One suspect, said the victim, shot him in the hip area. Hospital staff noted the possibility of the victim shooting himself by accident. Victim became uncooperative and officers later found no evidence of a shooting at the location.

The suspect, described as a male Hispanic, approached the Victim and pointed a gun at him and stated, "Give me your watch and empty your pockets." The victim complied. As the suspect was running away, he threw the victim's keys into a nearby bush.

Suspects approached the victim when he was trying to repair his overheated vehicle. One suspect offered to sell water. The victim showed the suspects his money and one suspect showed a pistol and stole the money. Suspect demanded victim
properties.address: Memory Park Avenue and Rayen Street

properties.synopsis: Suspect entered the Store, selected property and passed the register without making an attempt to pay. Suspect made eye contact with the cashier and stated she had a weapon. The suspect ran away with property.

Two male suspects approached the victim in an underground parking lot.  Suspects pointed a handgun at victim. The suspects hit the victim in the face and stole the victim’s wallet, cellular phone and currency.

The suspects entered and demanded beer and money from the store clerk. The suspects then attacked the clerk, who pulled out a billyclub and engaged the suspects, who took off. One of the suspects was later located suffering from a head injury as a result of the struggle with the store clerk and was taken to Northridge Hospital. He was booked on a robbery charge. Police were searching for a second person.
Victim was getting out of her car in the parking lot when she felt a tug on her purse. She turned and saw a suspect with a gun. She let go of her purse and the suspects fled on foot with her purse.
Suspect approached a clerk, pointed the pistol and demanded that the victim open the register and lie on the floor. Suspect stole money and fled. The robbery was caught on video tape.
Suspects entered the business, showed the clerk the butt of a pistol and said, "Give me the money." Clerk complied and suspect fled on foot.
Victim was pumping gas when the suspect approached on foot. Suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and demanded her cell phone and money. Suspect fled eastbound from the location.

The suspect approached the victim when he arrived at the delivery location and was still in his car. The suspect took out his wallet as if to pay for the pizza. A female suspect entered the back seat of the victim's car and pressed an unknown hard object into the victim's back. The victim was robbed of the pizza, cash, and his cell phone. Both suspects then ran away.

Two males approached a lone female from behind. One suspect grabbed her purse and attempted to pull it away. When the victim pulled on her purse to retain it, the second suspect punched her in the face, causing her to release it. Both suspects fled on foot.
Suspects used a ruse at the front door, produced a pistol and forced their way into the residence. Suspects stole money and fled in a vehicle.
Suspects approached a clerk and pointed the pistol at him. One suspect forced his way behind the counter while the second suspect stole property.

Victim told officers he was a DJ at a party where he was robbed of his equipment by three male Hispanic gang members. The gang members identified themselves as Mara Salvatrucha. Suspects were found and arrested.

Suspects entered the residence by an unlocked rear door. One suspect confronted the victim and demanded money. The second suspect stood near the rear door. The first suspect grabbed a laptop computer and said, "Let's go." Suspects fled in a white, four-door newer car, possibly a Mercedes.
The suspect approached a push-cart vendor and stated that he wanted an ice cream. The suspect then produced a folding knife and demanded money. The Victim in fear complied and the suspect ran away.
One suspect approached the clerk, pointed a pistol and demanded money. The clerk complied as the two suspects fled.

Three armed male suspects entered the business and ordered employees to the ground. The suspects removed wallets from the employees and removed property from the facility. Suspects fled out the rear door and ran westbound in the alley.

Victim was walking near the location when suspects pulled up and exited their vehicle. One suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and demanded money. Two suspects searched the victim and stole his wallet. This robbery was related to a previous robbery.

Victim was walking near the location when suspects pulled up and exited their vehicle. One suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and demanded money. Two suspects searched but found no wallet on the victim. Suspects stole victim's cell phone and jewelry.
Two black male suspects used a small caliber pistol to rob three victims of their property before taking off in an unknown direction.
Suspects approached the victim from behind and pushed him to the ground. One suspect pointed a pistol at the victim and stole victim's property. Suspects fled on foot.

Victim was walking in the area and she was passed the suspect on the sidewalk. Suspect was talking on a cell phone but as the victim passed, the suspect ordered the victim to give him her gold necklaces. When the victim didn't respond, the suspect grabbed the chains and punched the victim before leaving.

Officers responded to a call of a robbery in progress at a McDonald's restaurant. Three suspects were in the drive-through and ordered two cheeseburgers. As they moved up to the window, two suspects exited the vehicle, one armed with a possible pistol. Two suspects climbed through the drive-through window. One suspect went to the manager's office, broke the door's window and pointed the pistol at the manager who was completing a money count. The manager opened the door, the suspect entered and stole the money and the manager's cell phone. The second suspect inside was watching the other four employees. Both suspects fled the restaurant from the drive-through window. One suspect fired one round into the air. Suspects fled in a blue or black Toyota with tinted windows.
Victim was buying drugs from the suspects. Suspects showed a knife and demanded more money. Suspects stole victim's car keys and fled the location.
A suspect dressed all in white entered the business, displayed the pistol and stole money. Suspect fled eastbound on foot.

Suspect entered the business, pointed a pistol at the clerk and demanded money. Suspect jumped the counter and grabbed money from the register. Suspect fled in a blue or green, four-door vehicle. A video of the crime was obtained.
Suspect approached victim, threatened her with a knife and demanded her earrings and a watch. Victim complied and suspect fled on foot.
Suspect approached a produce vendor selling out of a van. Suspect pointed a pistol at the vendor and demanded money. She gave the suspect money and he fled the location in a four-door, black vehicle.
The suspect went into a bank, pulled a gun and demanded money. The teller provided the suspect with money. The suspect left the bank into a waiting vehicle.

A male suspect posed as a customer and waited in line at the checkout at the store. He showed the cashier an unknown type handgun and handed him a note that instructed him to put the money from the register in a bag.  The cashier complied and the suspect left walked out with currency.

Two male suspects, wearing ski masks, entered the store and demanded money from the clerk. One suspect struck the clerk in the head with the pistol and struck him again in the back after the clerk had fallen to the floor. Suspects removed property and fled on foot. Victim had a cut over one eye and declined medical treatment.

As the victims left a night club, two suspects approached, pointed a handgun at them and stated, "Give me everything you have!" One suspect grabbed one of the victim's purses. The second suspect got into a fight with a the second victim. The first suspect also joined in before both suspects took off through an alley and hopped into a car with two other suspects.
A suspect approached the victim and demanded his iPod. When victim refused, the suspect pulled a gun and again demanded the victim's property. The victim, in fear, complied.

The suspect entered the open apartment door, pointed a blue steel semi-automatic handgun at the victim and demanded money. The suspect exited and moments later returned with a second suspect. Together the suspects searched the victim’s residence. The suspects fled with the victim’s property. In fear, the victim delayed in reporting the incident.

Officers responded to a robbery. The same suspect from a prior robbery had returned with a handgun. After reviewing the video, it was determined the suspect was armed. Officers requested additional units to assist in searching the area. Officers saw a possible suspect riding a bicycle matching the description from the robbery and conducted a ped stop. Officers detained the suspect without incident and was he arrested for robbery.

One suspect approached the victim who was sitting outside a business at this location. Suspect pointed a pistol at the victim's head and said, "Give me that ****ing money." Victim complied while the second suspect stood by. Suspects fled on foot going westbound on Gault Street.
The suspect approached the victim, pointed a gun and demanded property. The victim, in fear, complied and the suspect fled with the victim's property.
Victim had been given a ride to the business to cash her check. The suspect, who had given her the ride, tackled her and grabbed teh check out of the victim's hand and fled the location.

A female Domino's Pizza delivery driver stopped at this location and was approached by the suspects. One suspect pointed a pistol to her side and demanded the pizza and money. Victim gave the second suspect $25. The second suspect searched the driver's car and, for unknown reason, gave the victim her cell phone. Suspects fled on foot.

The manager of a restraunat was walking to his vehicle with cash when he saw two Latino males in a brown vehicle parked in the rear alley. The male passenger, armed with a gun, got out of the vehicle and approached the manager. The manager in fear gave the suspect the cash. The suspects took off north in the rear alley. The suspects pushed a vehicle (parked at the apron of the alley leading into the street) out of the way to escape.
The suspect approached the victim behind the counter. The suspect pulled a shotgun and demanded money. The victim, in fear, complied. The suspect got into his vehicle and took off.

Two victims were standing on the sidewalk when the suspects approached. One suspect produced a pistol and the others produced knives. One suspect pointed a pistol at one victim's head and said, in Spanish, to give him money or he would kill him. Suspect removed the wallet from the victim's pocket and walked away from the location. The second victim fled on foot. The suspects with the knives caught up with him. Second victim was punched in the face and pushed to the ground. Suspects did not take any property from the second victim and they walked away from the location.
Suspect followed the victim into an underground parking area and confronted victim from behind. Suspect, holding a pistol, demanded victim's wallet. Suspect fled on foot.

Two victims were walking when the suspects exited a black Honda. Suspects asked the victims if they knew anyone who sold marijuana. Suspects demanded necklace from one victim and the wallet of the second victim. One suspect displayed a pistol.

Victim was riding his bicycle when suspects pulled up beside him in a car. Suspects stopped and exited the vehicle. One suspect approached the victim with a knife and slashed at the victim, cutting his right thumb. Suspect demanded the bicycle and wallet. Victim gave up the wallet but not the bicycle. Suspects removed the money from the wallet and fled westbound on Saticoy Street.
One suspect hit victim on the head with a baseball bat. Suspects stole money from the victim's pocket and fled in a possible Chevrolet Blazer. Victim was taken to a hospital in critical condition.
A man possibly wearing a Dodgers cap went into a U.S. Bank branch and passed a note to a teller demanding money, but it was unclear whether the bandit made off with any cash.

The victim and his wife were in the parking lot of the Sports Authority store. As they got out of their vehicle, five 13-17-year-old Hispanic males ran towards them from across the street and surrounded them. One suspect pulled a small handgun from his pocket, pointed it at the ground in front of the victims, and demanded their property. The victims complied and all the suspects ran away and into an apartment complex on Parthenia Street. The victims were not injured.

The suspect, described as a black male forced open the front door of the victim's residence. The suspect pointed a handgun at the victim, demanded property and struck the victim on the head with the handgun. The suspect fled with the victim's purse.

The victim is a pizza delivery employee. After delivering the pizza, the victim walked towards his vehicle when he observed a vehicle stop in the middle of the roadway and three suspects exited. The victim ran towards his vehicle and was immediately surrounded by the gun and knife wielding suspects. They demanded his money and the victim in fear complied. The victim ran in an attempt to escape but was tripped by one of the suspects. The suspects fled in their vehicle with the victim's property.
properties.injuries: Scrapes, bruise to top of head

properties.synopsis: The victim picked up the suspects because they needed a ride. The victim stopped exited his vehicle at which time one suspect struck the victim on the forehead and upper back with a hammer. The same suspect took the victim’s wallet. All three suspects fled on foot.
properties.injuries: Bruise to forehead and upper back

properties.synopsis: The suspect approached a business, showed a handgun in his waistband and demanded the money from the register. The cashier, in fear, gave the suspect about $500 cash before the suspect took off.

The suspects walked behind the victims. Each suspect produced a handgun and both suspects stated to the victims, "Give me your purse." The suspects fled the location in a black Nissan. Someone got the suspects’ vehicle license plate. Police arrested suspects and believe this case was connected to another one 10 minutes earlier on Magnolia Avenue.

One suspect entered the location and bought coffee. The second suspect entered, threatened the clerk with a pistol and demanded that the register be opened. Suspect jumped over the counter but was unable to get into the register. The first suspect stole the clerk's cell phone. Suspects fled on foot.

The suspects drove up next to victims as they were placing groceries into their vehicle. The suspects pointed a small black handgun at victims, while stating "Give me your purse." Police believe this case is connected to another one on Laurel Canyon Boulevard in North Hollywood 10 minutes later.
A gunman entered a market and threatened the cashier to hand over money from the cash register. The suspect then took off.
Officers found a large group near the rear of this location. Four workers at the business had been robbed as they left the rear door after closing time. Five suspects were arrested.

Three suspects in a vehicle pulled alongside the victim who was riding his bicycle. Two suspects got out of the vehicle and approached the victim. One suspect pulled a knife and demanded the victim’s property. The victim in fear complied. The suspects entered the vehicle and fled.
Two male suspects entered this location, pointed guns and demanded money. Suspects fled with $459 in a four-door, gray Toyota Camry.

The suspect entered a location and ordered food. The suspect then demands all the money in the register and displays a knife. The victim in fear for her safety removed all the money from the register and placed it on the counter. The suspect pointed the knife at the cashier and picked up the cash and ran away.

The suspect entered the market armed with a handgun. The suspect located the store manager and at gun point directed the manager to the store office. The suspect then ordered the manager to open the store safe, the manager then grabbed for the suspects handgun and a struggle ensued. As a result of the struggle, the handgun was fired twice times with no injury to anyone. The suspect took the money and disappeared in an unknown direction.
properties.address: San Fernando Mission Boulevard and Woodley Avenue

properties.synopsis: Suspects entered the business, pointed a gun at the clerk and demanded money. Suspects fled with money in a 1998 Toyota Tercel. One suspect had picked up a can of soda during the robbery and officers were able to get a good print off of the can.

Victim is a pizza delivery driver and had just completed a delivery. Suspects approached victim on foot. The male suspect simulated a gun while the female suspect took approximately $50 from the victim. Suspects fled on foot.

Victim had bought items at a business on Devonshire Street and Zelzah Avenue. He noticed two suspects, standing outside of the door, staring at him when he exited. Victim began walking southbound toward Granada Hills High School when the same two suspects approached him and asked for the time. When the victim pulled out his cell phone to check, one suspect stole the phone and pushed the victim. Both suspects ran to a waiting vehicle, with two more suspects. Victim wrote down the vehicle's license plate number.

The suspects approached the victim as he got out of his vehicle and ordered him into a prone position where one suspect held a gun to his head and removed his wallet, which contained money. The suspects fled in a vehicle that was parked on a side street.
The suspect approached victim and demanded the victim’s property. The suspect brandished a handgun and the victim, in fear, gave the suspect money. The suspect took off west on Ventura Boulevard.
Suspects entered the business, pointed a gun at the clerk and demanded money. Victim was able to get a license plate number to a 1981 Toyota with a 1994 expiration tag.

A suspect approached a victim from behind, grabbed the victim by the neck with one hand and placed a gun against the victim's head with the other. The suspect demanded the victim's cell phone and then fled to a nearby vehicle.
Suspects approached the victim, displayed a pistol and demanded the victim's property. Victim complied and suspects fled.

The victim was working as a gardener in front of a residence when a vehicle drove up. Two suspects exited the vehicle and approached him with a handgun and demanded his property. When he said he didn’t have any, one suspect entered the victim’s vehicle and took his property. Suspects then fled.
A suspect waited until customers left, pulled a handgun and demanded money.

Victim was walking near the location when the suspects approached and demanded victim's property. Victim initially refused but, when a pistol was shown, complied. Suspects fled eastbound on Burbank Boulevard.

Victim is a pizza delivery driver and had just completed a delivery. Victim was sitting in the vehicle when the suspects approached, simulated a gun and demanded money. Victim complied and suspects fled with $7.
Two male suspects, driving a four-door white sedan, entered the business armed with pistols. Suspects stole $300 from the register.

The victim was standing outside of his store when the suspect pistol-whipped him. The suspect took money from the victim and then entered the store. When the suspect was unable to find any more money, he ran away. The victim was taken to Kaiser Hospital for stitches.

Two suspects, wearing dark blue and black sweatshirts with hoods, entered the market. Suspect pointed a gun at the clerk and demanded the register's money. Suspects fled in a gray, possible, Toyota. Suspects match the description of nine prior robberies that have occurred throughout the San Fernando Valley.

Suspect walked up to the counter, placed a vinyl bag on the counter and demanded that the cashier put money in the bag. The cashier saw that the suspect was holding a pistol and complied with the demand.
The suspects approached the apartment where the victims were at with a handgun, entered and demanded money. The Suspects took off north through the apartment complex with the victim's money.

Two victims were walking on the sidewalk when the suspects approached them. One suspect pointed a rifle at the victims and demanded, in Spanish, give me your money. The other suspect advised the first suspect to shoot the victims. One victim handed over his wallet and the suspect with the rifle removed the other victim's wallet and cell phone. Suspects fled on foot.
Suspects approached the victims, pointed handguns at them and demanded money. The victims complied and the suspects fled with the victim's property.
Suspects entered the business, pointed guns at the employee and demanded money. One suspect jumped the counter and took the money.

Two male suspects entered the location, displayed pistols and demanded property and money. Clerk engaged in a physical altercation with the suspects. Suspects fled and there was no injury to the clerk.

An ice cream vender was robbed at knife point and punched in the face by one of the two male suspects who then took off running. The victim followed the suspects and observed them go into an apartment building. Upon arrival officers requested additional units and conducted a follow-up to the location and the suspects were taken into custody without incident.

The victim and a female friend were at a park when they were approached by three male suspects. One suspect asked where the victim was from. When the victim replied he did not belong to a gang, the same suspect asked him where he kept his gun. The victim replied he did not have a gun. One of the other suspects lifted his shirt to reveal a handgun in his waistband. The first suspect then grabbed the victim's bicycle and all three suspects took off running.
The suspect approached the victim, pointed a handgun at him and demanded property. The victim then was told to walk away. The suspect took off in the opposite direction.

Officers were flagged down by the victim. The victim was approached by knife-wielding suspects who demanded his property. The victim, in fear, gave the suspect his property. Both suspects, described as male Hispanics, fled then ran away. Police found both suspects and arrested them. The knife and property were recovered.
The suspect, described as male black, entered the location, pulled a gun and demanded money, then took off in an unknown sedan.

Victim was walking when approached by the suspects. One suspect placed an unknown sharp object into the victim's back, threatened to stab the victim and demanded property. The second suspect removed the victim's IPod from a pocket and then suspects fled on foot.
The suspects approached the victim, pulled a knife and began to beat him with a scooter. The suspects removed property from the victim. Police later arrested two of the suspects.

The victims were sitting in a vehicle when the suspect, described as male Hispanic, walked up and pointed a handgun to their heads and stated, "Don’t look at me. Give me everything or I’ll shoot you." The victims gave their property to the suspect who took off running.

Victim was at an ATM at a Bank of America to deposit a check. A male suspect, wearing a black ski mask, approached the victim was demanded $500. Victim withdrew $200, suspect grabbed the money and fled on foot through an alley.
The suspect selected a pair of shoes at a retail store and went to the counter to pay. The suspect sprayed the clerk with pepper spray and took money from the register, then ran away.

A robbery was reported last night at 8 in the 5800 block of Tujunga Avenue in North Hollywood. While the victim was walking home, five male Hispanics approached him from behind. One of the suspects struck the victim in the back of the head with a baseball bat. Another suspect stated, "We need your money. Give us your wallet." The victim complied, at which time the suspects became upset that the victim only had $5 in his wallet. One of the suspects stated, "I’m going to kill you." The suspect then punched and kicked the victim. The victim temporarily lost consciousness and the suspects fled.

Officers responded to a robbery investigation at the victim’s residence. The victim, out of fear, did not report immediately report the incident, which occurred sometime between 4:30 p.m. and 5 p.m. The victim and his friend were walking out of Valley Plaza Park when three male Hispanics in a vehicle approached them. While asking the victims for directions, one suspect pointed a shotgun at them and the second suspect pointed a handgun at them. Both suspects demanded that the Victims toss their property into the backseat of their vehicle. The victims complied and the suspects fled in their vehicle.
properties.address: Laurel Grove Avenue and Erwin Street

properties.synopsis: The victim stated that on June, 26, 2008 at about 4 p.m. he opened the door and was jumped by three suspects. The suspects hit, choked, and struck the victim on the face with a stick. The suspects spent about 20 minutes inside his residence and removed numerous electronic items and fled in an unknown direction.
Victim was walking to her car when suspect approached and demanded her purse. Suspect struck victim in the forehead with his fist and took her purse. Suspect fled eastbound.

A man described as white entered the business, pulled a shotgun and demanded cash, before he took off in a stolen tow truck. Police recovered the stolen vehicle and weapon in an alley off of Lindley, but found no suspect.

The suspects approached the victim, who was sleeping under a blanket, and began kicking him. During the assault the suspects removed the victim’s watch and necklace. The suspects then fled with the victim’s bicycle in an unknown direction.
