A male Hispanic was shot twice in front of an apartment complex during a robbery. The victim was transported to Holy Cross Medical Center where he was treated for two gunshot wounds. The victim was listed in critical but stable condition. The suspects were described as three male Hispanics.

Two suspects entered the business. One suspect had a pistol. Two suspects tied up the only employee and removed property . The third suspect was a lookout. The suspects fled on foot southbound through an alley.

Two male black suspects approached the victims. One suspect displayed a blue steel semi-auto handgun and pressed it to the back of the head of one victim and removed his property. A second suspect pointed a handgun at a second victim, then kicked and punched him. Then both suspects took off with property from the first victim.

The victim was preparing to open a recycling center when he was approached by two black male suspects who began punching him in the face. The victim fought back until he was struck on the head with a chrome handgun by one of the suspects. The suspect then pointed the handgun at him while both suspects searched through his pockets removing his property.
Two suspects, one with a gun, approached the location, demanded and took the money, then fled the location in a vehicle.

The victims met the female suspects while bowling. The suspects, described as two female and male Hispanics in their 20s, asked for a ride home and led the them to a vacant house. The suspects lulled the victims inside. Once the victims were inside, they were confronted by the male suspects. The male suspects beat the victims. The suspects took the victim’s property and fled. The victims were transported to Northridge Hospital and were treated and released.

Suspect entered the business and pointed a pistol at an employee. Suspect forced employee into a back room and locked her inside. Suspect took money from the register, victim's purse and IPod. Employee was able to get out of the room to call the police. Videotape shows suspect trying to cover his face with a towel as he walked through the business.

An off-duty officer, aware of robberies overnight, observed a suspect in a vehicle matching the license plate from a robbery. Officer followed the suspect until on-duty officers arrived and made the arrest.
Two male suspects, armed with pistols, entered a mini-market. Suspects ordered the employees to the floor and then stole money from the register. Suspects were later arrested.

Victim stopped to buy a drink at a gas station. Suspect confronted victim as he got out of his car. Suspect told victim to withdraw money from the store's ATM. The victim complied. Suspect then ordered the victim to get back into his vehicle while the suspect sat in the passenger seat. The suspect also stole more money from the glove compartment. Suspect ordered the victim to pull over and suspect then fled on foot.

Officers met with the victim. The victim advised officers that she was walking on Van Nuys at Beachy, when she was approached by a female suspect. The suspect proceeded to speak with the victim when she was suddenly pushed from behind into a van. A male suspect proceeded to tell the victim that she was being kidnapped and wanted money from her in order to be released. The victim was able to jump out of the van and ran home. The incident began at 4:30 p.m., but the victim didn't call police to report it until 9 p.m. Due to the inconsistent and continuing changing statements made by the victim, the delay in the reporting the staleness of the crime and no follow-up, no notifications were warranted at the time.
properties.address: Beachy Avenue and Van Nuys Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Victims returns home and found suspects in their residence. Suspects punched both victims, causing them to lose consciousness. Bedrooms ransacked and money was taken.

Victim was seated in his vehicle in a parking lot near a bar when the suspect approached him and pointed a gun at his head. The suspect demanded victim's money. The suspect then struck the victim in the head. The victim lost consciousness. When victim regained consciousness while on the ground, he saw the suspect driving away with his car.

Victim was in the alley behind the Roman Holiday Spa when the three suspects approached victim on foot. One of the suspects said, "We're going to teach you gays a lesson." Victim was knocked to the ground, punched and kicked and his wallet was taken.

Suspects flagged down a driver at the above location. When victim stopped, the suspects got into the vehicle and placed an object, possibly a knife, to the victim's side and directed him to drive. Victim complied. Suspects had victim stop the vehicle, both punched the victim and stole his property. Suspects fled on foot.

Victim was waiting at a bus stop near the location when suspects pulled up in a four-door, tan car. Suspects dragged victim into the car and held her down in the back seat. One suspect sexually assaulted victim (not raped) while she was being held down. Victim was able to escape from the suspects near the 8000 block of Deering Avenue. Suspects fled in an unknown location.
properties.address: Roscoe Boulevard and Topanga Canyon Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Victim was outside, smoking a cigarette, when an unknown vehicle pulled up next to him. Suspects(s) yelled out and shot an unknown number of times, striking the victim in the face. Victim was taken to Holy Cross Medical Center in stable condition.
Victim had heard a single shot fired and discovered a bullet hole in the front window of his home.
Someone heard a gunshot and saw someone lying in a hallway with a gunshot wound to the leg. The victim was taken to Tarzana Hospital by his friends. No suspects were seen.
The suspects approached the victims who were in a vehicle. The suspects then fired several rounds from a handgun, striking one victim in the abdomen and the other in the foot before taking off.
Victim was leaving his vehicle when suspects fired at him from their vehicle. The victim, a gang member, was shot in the leg.
properties.address: Langdon Street and south of Rayen Street

properties.synopsis: Victim was driving southbound on Tampa Avenue near Chase Street when a white SUV with three suspects drove alongside. One of the suspects fired three shots in the direction of the victim's vehicle. The gunfire did not strike the victim or his vehicle. Suspects fled the scene.
Suspects drove alongside victims' vehicle and fired rounds at two victims. Passenger was hit. Suspects fled in their vehicle. Hit victim was in stable condition at a hospital.

Officers responded to an "ADW shots fired" call and met with the victim/suspect, who had been stabbed in the leg. The investigation revealed that two neighbors were involved in an argument. One of the neighbors (victim/ suspect) brandishing and discharging a handgun (the round failed to strike anyone). The other neighbor (victim/suspect) grabbed a knife and stabbed one of the victim/suspects in the leg. The stabbing victim was transported to the hospital and is in stable condition. The stabbing suspect fled the scene.

A 17-year-old was treated for a BB-shot wound to the jaw after a drive-by attack outside the Verdugo Community Pool in Tujunga. The victim said he was with several companions outside the pool when a vehicle rolled by and one round was fired. The vehicle had up to four people in it and appeared to be a green Honda. The victim was being treated at a local hospital, where he was having the projectile removed from his jaw.

The suspect was seated in his residence when he heard numerous fireworks. He then saw two males jump over the fence and into his backyard. The suspect went outside and told them to stop. The males responded, "Fxxx you!"  The suspect, in fear, ran inside his residence and retrieved his handgun. When the suspect returned to his backyard, he observed another male jump the fence and attempt to hide. In fear, the suspect fired his weapon twice into the grass in an attempt to scare the males. The suspects then fled his backyard and jumped the fence into his neighbor's yard. It was later discovered that the males were running from the police due to the illegal fireworks they ignited.
One suspect, witnesses said, stood in the middle of the street and fired a pistol at a vehicle as it passed and continued to run, shooting at the vehicle down the street.

Officers responded to a radio call of an assault with a deadly weapon - shooting. Upon arrival they found a male black suffering from a gunshot wound. The victim’s friend, a witness, stated that he and the victim had been attempting to buy marijuana in the park when the dealer shot one of them. The victim was transported to Holy Cross Hospital. Later, both the victim and witness were identified as suspects in the robbery of an armored car in Lancaster. The "victim" of the shooting was shot by an armored car guard during the robbery.  Both suspects were arrested by Los Angeles County Sheriff's deputies and the evidence was transferred to their custody.

A suspect accused victim of looking at his girlfriend then went to his vehicle. When victim came out of the store, the suspect drove by the victim and shot one round at the victim. Then the gunman took off south.
Two suspects followed the victim into an apartment building where a confrontation took place. Suspect(s) fired multiple times and fled. Victim was uncooperative.
Suspects drove by victims residence and fired a round into the house. The victims stated that they have no gang affiliation.

Officers were working surveillance in the area when one officer observed a shooting in progress. One suspect was arrested. The victim, who was shot in the shoulder, was taken to a hospital in stable condition.
properties.address: Terra Bella Street and DeHaven Avenue

properties.synopsis: A man in his 20s was shot during a confrontation with as many as five men behind a Ralphs supermarket. Police and paramedics sent to Kittridge Street and Saint Clair Avenue found the victim with a gunshot wound to the butt, said Richard French with the Los Angeles Police Department. The suspects, male Hispanics in their 20s, fled the scene in a newer model Mustang, which may have been green, French said.
properties.address: Archwood Street and Saint Clair Avenue

properties.synopsis: Suspect took victim's cell phone. Victim told his father. Father and victim confronted suspect. The suspect threw the phone back at the victim. As the father and victim attempted to drive away, the suspect fired at the vehicle and the victim was hit in the shoulder. Victim was in stable condition at a hospital.

A suspect accused victim of looking at his girlfriend then went to his vehicle. When victim came out of the store, the suspect drove by the victim and shot one round at the victim. Then the gunman took off south.
Officers responded to the hospital for a shooting victim. Victim was uncooperative. An unknown person took victim to the hosptial and dropped him off.
The victim, a gang member, was shot in the jaw while being driven by his girlfriend.
properties.address: Laurel Canyon Boulevard and Rinaldi Street

properties.synopsis: Three male and two female suspects, in a gold-colored vehicle, shot at a victim who was in front of the Valley Swap Meet.

Gang members approached the victims, who were seated inside their vehicle on Elmer Avenue and asked the victims why they were in the suspects' neighborhood. The suspects got into a fight with the victims. Then the victims took off. The victims heard a gunshot and saw the rear window to their vehicle had shatter. The victims continued to drive away and called police. Officers responded to the scene and interviewed the victims.  Officers conducted a follow-up to a location. Officers received consent to search the residence and located five possible suspects involved in the shooting. The victims positively identified all suspects, and the suspects were taken into custody.
Suspect walked by three victim victims an shook their hands. The suspect walked on but turned and fired three to fire rounds at the victims.

Officers responded to a "shots fired." Unknown suspects pulled up behind the victims' vehicle. One suspect got out of the vehicle and shot a shotgun round at the victim's vehicle. The suspects took off in an unknown direction.

One suspect entered the PDQ Market and placed beer on the counter near the cash register. The suspect refused to pay for the beer and fled the location with the beer. The clerk, armed with a pistol, ran after the suspect. The clerk fired one round into the ground and the suspect left the beer on the ground and fled in a vehicle.

Police responded to Northridge Hospital for an assault with a deadly weapon investigation. The victims were sitting in their vehicle at when suspects fired an unknown gun at them, striking them in the leg/feet area. No suspects seen.

The victims were in front of this location when a vehicle drove by with two occupants. Passenger fired upon the victims. Victims did not hear suspects say anything. One of the victims was hit in the groin area and was listed in stable condition in a hospital.

Police responded to the northwest corner of Osborne and Remick for an shooting. The 34-year old victim had been shot multiple times for unknown reasons and was transported to Holy Cross, where he underwent surgery and was listed in stable condition. No motive or suspect leads were developed in the initial investigation.

The victim, a gang member, was standing in front of the location when the suspects approached on foot. Suspects and victim argued. One of the suspects drew a pistol and fired at the victim, hitting him in the abdomen. Suspect ran to a vehicle and fled the location. A witness said that the victim and one of the suspects had argued earlier in the day.

Officers responded to a shots fired radio call. Officers were directed to the suspect’s locations where the suspect was detained without incident. The suspect admitted to firing the shots and consented to a search of his residence. The weapon was found. The officers’ investigation revealed the suspect fired one round out of his window, striking a passing motorist vehicle. The suspect was subsequently arrested.
Suspects fired at victim's vehicle after a business dispute over a car that the suspects claimed was a lemon.
Three victims were in the rear yard when a vehicle drove down the alley and suspects fired approximately six rounds that hit the wall of the house.

Suspects drove up and parked in an alley where the victim was standing. The suspects shot the victim three times and drove away northbound. Victim was shot in the abdomen and arm but was in stable condition at a hospital.

Officers responded to a "415 Man with a Gun" radio call. The suspect was taken into custody without incident.  Two handguns were recovered from inside the suspect vehicle. Officers interviewed all four victims and determined that an assault with a deadly weapon with a gun had occurred. The suspect was positively identified by the victims and booked for ADW. The suspect was treated for pain to his right wrist.
Victim told officers he had a road rage incident with two male suspects. The suspects had fired one round in the victim's direction.
Officers met victim at a hospital and learned that the victim had been been wounded at the location.

Officers responded to a shooting investigation and located a female victim with a gunshot wound to her legs. She advised officers that she was inside of her studio apartment (which faces out towards Sepulveda) when she heard a gunshot outside and was subsequently stuck by the gun fire. The victim was transported to the hospital and listed in stable condition.

Officers responded to a shots fired call and met two adult and one juvenile victims. One victim had a gunshot to abdomen. Unknown suspect approached victims while they were standing in front of the location. Suspect began shooting. Victims ran to the rear of the residence when one adult was shot. Gunshot victim was taken to a hospital with non-life threatening injury. Witnesses and victims were unable to identify suspects.
Suspects drove to the location. One suspect fired three shots at an apartment complex where there is gang activity.

Victim was driving around his neighborhood looking for his 14 year old son. Victim observed a male, standing in the shadows, who was pointing a laser at him. Victim heard a single shot and felt pain to his ankle. He drove home and another son took him to a hospital.
Officers responded to a shooting. Apartment manager, at a known gang location, had been shot twice, in the wrist and shoulder-rib area. Victim was listed in stable condition.

Victim was sitting on his porch and was approached by one suspect. Suspect shot victim in the upper abdomen. Suspect got in a waiting compact car. Suspects fled the location. Victim was transported to the hosptial in stable condition.
The suspects, male Hispanics, drove by the victim's car, hitting it three times and the victim in the back. The victim drove home and was taken by ambulance in stable condition.
Officers responded to a shooting in progress radio call. Officers were unable to locate a victim or suspect.  Officers located several casing at scene and were booked and a report was completed.

Victim received a grazed gunshot to the left arm as she was standing in an alley with her boyfriend and her mother. Suspects had driven by the group and fired shots at them. The boyfriend fled the location and was later shot in the neck and taken to a hospital.

The victims were in front of the location. The suspect walked up to the group and began firing. Three victims were struck. One victim was hit in the thigh. One victim was shot in the left arm and groin area. Victims were expected to recover. Witnesses were vague as to the circumstances.
Victim was riding his bike near the location when suspects drove up. Suspects fired three to four shots and then fled southbound.

The suspects approached the victims and asked the victim where he was from. The suspects fired one round at the suspects and grazed the victim in the head. The victim was taken to Pacifica Hospital and is expected to make a full recovery. The victim is a former gang member who recently had a falling out with the gang. The victim believes that the suspects were from the same gang. Gang officers conducted a follow-up where the suspect vehicle was located. Officers located four possible suspects inside the vehicle. All four suspects were detained and transported to North Hollywood station. One suspect was booked on a no bail warrant and a second suspect was arrested for possession of methamphetamines. The remaining two suspects were questioned and released.
A male suspect in a vehicle fired at several pedestrians on the street. A school bus with children on it witnessed the incident. The school bus was not hit.
Suspect(s) fired multiple times at the victim's residence. The residence was struck three times.

The victim was riding in a car when another vehicle drove alongside and fired several rounds into the vehicle, striking the victim on the arm. The victim stated that it occurred somewhere near Osborne and Dronfield. The suspects took off in an unknown direction.  The victim was taken to Holy Cross to be treated for wounds considered not life threatening. Police could not find the crime scene.

Officers responded to the hospital and met with the victim. The victim stated he was visiting a friend at the above location when he was confronted by the suspects, six to seven Hispanic males, one armed with a chrome semi-auto. The victim ran towards his vehicle without say a word when he was shot in both legs. The victim subsequently transported himself to the hospital after picking up a female friend. Officers responded to the location where the victim claimed the shooting occurred but could not locate any evidence of a shooting. The victim’s vehicle was impounded for evidence (officers located a bullet hole on the driver side door). The victim’s injury were not life threatening.

The victim and suspect confront one another at the above location. The victim and suspect exchanged words; the suspect then pulled out a handgun and fired several rounds at the victim, striking the victim approximately two times around the buttocks area. Officers in the area were directed towards the suspect and took him into custody without incident. The victim was transported to the hospital where he was treated for his wounds.
Someone pulled a pistol and fired about five rounds at the victim, striking him twice in the abdomen area. The gunman then took off in a truck. The victim is in stable condition.
Victim went to the suspect's residence where the two had an argument. Suspect shot the victim in the leg.

The victim, a Barrio Van Nuys gang associate was taken by family members to Valley Presbyterian Hospital, where he was his listed in critical condition. The victim had an argument with unknown males at which time one of them fired numerous rounds striking the victim in the back about six times.

The victim was walking near the above location when a suspect approached and began hitting and kicking him. The suspect then pulled out a gun and shot the victim in the back. The victim was transported to a local hospital were he was in stable condition. As officers were interviewing the victim at the hospital, the victim changed his story several times and refused to sign a crime report.

The suspect arrived at a church carnival armed with a rifle. The suspect shot his ex-girlfriend and two other citizens. The suspect was tackled by other citizens and held for police. Upon arrival, police took custody of the suspect without further incident. All victims were transported to Holy Cross Hospital and are in stable condition. The Suspect was booked for attempt murder.

The victim was driving when the victim’s vehicle was side-swiped by the suspect’s vehicle. Shots were fired from the passenger side of the suspect’s vehicle. The victim was shot once in the elbow and transported to Olive View Hospital in stable condition.
properties.address: De Foe Avenue and Bledsoe Street

properties.synopsis: A woman, entering her vehicle parked at the curb, observed a man running toward her from Hart Street. The man was holding a pistol that was partially covered with a shirt.. The suspect fired several rounds at a Honda Accord that was driving away. One round struck the woman's vehicle and broke a side window. The suspect and the Honda fled the location. No injuries were reported.
Two victims were walking when the suspects drove up next to them and began shooting. Both victims were hit. Suspects fled southbound. Victims were taken to a hospital and listed in good condition.

Suspect(s) fired several times into a residence. Officers entered the residence to see if there were any victims to the shooting. There were no victims but there was a pistol on a couch. The shooting appeared to be drug-related.
Victim was in front of his house when the two suspects drove up and fired one round. Victim was hit in the leg and friends drove victim to a hospital.

The victim was inside his residence when he heard the car alarm to his parked vehicle going off. The victim went outside to investigate and observed a suspect inside his vehicle. The suspect, described as a male Hispanic, ran to his own vehicle, being driven by a female Hispanic. She fired four rounds from a handgun at the victim before the suspects drove off in their vehicle.

A family dispute between two brothers resulted in one shooting the other. It began as a possible barricaded suspect but after a short time, the suspect came out of the residence and surrendered. The victim received a gunshot wound to his leg and was taken to Holy Cross and he is in stable condition.

On arrival, police located a victim down with a gunshot wound to his right thigh. The victim was transported to Northridge Hospital where he was treated for his wound. It appears that the victim was walking down the street when a vehicle pulled up and fired an unknown amount of rounds, hitting the victim in the leg. The suspect did not say anything to the victim prior to the shooting.

The victims were standing in front of their residence when the suspects pulled up in a vehicle. The suspects asked if they were from a gang. The victims told them that they were not in a gang at which time, the driver suspect reached over the passenger and fired one round, striking one of the victims in the elbow. The suspects then sped off.

Unknown suspects in a vehicle challenged some victims in another vehicle. The victims ignored the suspects and continued to drive away. The suspects fired from a pistol at the victims' vehicle, causing a flat tire. The suspects took off in their vehicle. The victims were not injured.
properties.address: Vanowen Street and Laurel Canyon Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Officers responded to a shooting call location which victim was gone on arrival. Officers located a witness, a friend of the victim, who stated that the victim got into an argument in front of the location. The victim lifted his shirt to show his Pacoima tattoo at which time a suspect fired a round at the victim from a black pickup truck. The suspect and the victim took off. There was no evidence located by officers.
Officers responded to a shooting investigation and found a parked vehicle with three bullet holes. There was no victim inside the vehicle.

Vice officers brought in an arrestee who solicited an undercover male officer at Hansen Dam. The arrestee is an employee for the Los Angeles Unified School District. Initially, it was believed that the arrestee was a teacher, but it was determined that he is a program coordinator who works out of the District Office on Balboa Boulevard. An arrest of this type did not require any notifications to the School District.

The victim and suspect are dating the same woman. The victim saw the suspect’s vehicle parked in front of his girlfriend’s house. As the victim was looking at the vehicle, the suspect approached him from behind and stabbed him once in the ribs with a knife and told him he was going to kill him. The victim took off and was later treated for his wound, but refused to be taken to a hospital. Police found the vehicle parked on Tyler Street and Foothill Boulevard and searched the area, but were unable to locate the suspect.

The suspect and victim were drinking together and became involved in an argument. The argument escalated into a fight. The suspect stabbed the victim in the abdomen. The Victim was transported to Holy Cross and is in grave condition. Detectives responded and later the Suspect was taken into custody.
Male victim was stabbed in the chest by the suspect. Victim was dating the suspect's ex-girlfriend. Victim was taken to a hospital in stable condition.
Three male Hispanics approached two victims and asked where they were from. There was a fight and the two victims were stabbed. One victim was in critical condition and taken to a hospital.

The victim and the suspect are roommates and got into an argument/mutual combat in the parking lot near their residence. The suspect stabbed the victim twice during the fight. The victim was transported to the hospital and treated for stab wounds. The victim’s wounds required stitches and he is expected to be released shortly.  When cops arrived, the suspect was gone.
properties.injuries: Stab wound to chest, laceration to wrist

properties.synopsis: Victim and suspect had an argument and suspect stabbed victim in the left hand. Victim refused medical treatment and suspect was arrested.
properties.address: Saticoy Street and Van Nuys Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Officers responded to a stabbing at an Arco gas station. Victim and suspect had an argument over property. Suspect stabbed victim in the lower stomach area. Suspect fled on foot. Victim was taken to a hospital and was unable to provide officers with details of the incident.

The victim and the suspect were involved in a fight. The suspect armed himself with a knife and stabbed the victim multiple times on the arm and back. The suspect was subsequently located and identified. The victim was transported to Northridge Hospital and listed in stable condition.
Victim and suspect were drinking when they had an argument. Suspect stabbed the victim in the neck area. Victim was listed in critical condition.
Husband and wife were arguing and wife stabbed husband. Wife fled the residence on foot. Victim's injuries were not life-threatening.

The suspects surrounded the victim and challenged the victim for being in their neighborhood. The suspects punched the victim and then one of the suspects picked up a broken beer bottle and struck the victim in the neck. The suspects fled the scene in an unknown direction. The victim was treated for his injuries.

Officers responded to the hospital for a stabbing call. The victim stated that while he was walking, the suspect crossed the street and approached him. Without saying a word, the suspect punched the victim in the face. The victim fought back, but was stabbed in the hip area. The victim was in stable condition and was released from the hospital.
Victim and the suspect, his brother, were involved in a dispute. Suspect used a kitchen knife to slash his brother's right hand. Victim had a very minor cut to his hand. The suspect was arrested.

The victim and suspect lived together but victim told suspect that he was ending their relationship and moving out. The suspect stabbed the victim in the hand and stomach area with a piece of broken glass. Victim was taken to a hospital in stable condition. Female suspect fled the location.

Officers responded to a hospital for victims' of a stabbing. Victims were at the location when a resident got angry because victims were taking up parking spaces in a carport. Suspect and victims argued and suspect stabbed one victim multiple times. The other victims were stabbed trying to help the first victim. Suspect was located but there was no evidence found in the carport.

Suspect in an unknown vehicle followed victim. The suspect exited his vehicle and became involved in an argument with the victim. The suspect pulled a knife and stabbed the victim in the torso. The wounds were not life threatening.

Victim was inside location with a friend and people he did not know. Victim told officers he was by the sink when he was struck numerous times in the head with a frying pan and then stabbed multiple times. The victim could not identify a suspect. Victim had stabs wounds to the neck and body and bumps on head and face.
Suspects approached a victim and asked "where you from?" When the victim stated "nowhere" the suspects struck him with a bat and stabbed him. The victim is in stable condition.
properties.address: Van Nuys Boulevard and Sherman Way
properties.injuries: Blunt trauma, puncture wounds to chest

properties.synopsis: Victim and suspect, roommates, had been drinking. They argued and suspect stabbed victim in the back with a butcher knife. Victim received 11 stitches.

Officers responded to the hospital and met with the victim. The victim stated he accompanied his sister to the suspect’s residence (sister’s ex-boyfriend). His sister and the suspect became involved in a dispute and when the victim stepped in between them, the suspect armed himself with a straight edge and cut the victim on the forearm and head. The victim was able to fight off the suspect and subsequently transported to the hospital by family members. Officers responded to the suspect’s residence and arrested the suspect without incident. Officers also recovered the weapon used by the suspect. The victim’s injury were not life threatening.

Suspect had been fired by the employer at this business. Suspect stabbed two employees. One of the employees shot the suspect. Suspect was taken to a hospital in critical condition. Two victims were taken to a hospital.
Officers established a perimeter involving a stolen vehicle where the driver fled on foot. K-9 responded and the suspect was located and captured without incident. The passenger was later released.

Victim received several calls on his cell phone from a restricted number. A male caller told the victim to go outside and get the package. The victim saw a PETCO box on the porch but was afraid to open it. Victim called the police. The area was secured and evacuated pending the arrival of the bomb squad. The bomb squad X-rayed the package and it was found to have feces only.
Two male suspects, armed with pistols, entered the business. Suspects removed money from all cashiers at the front counter and money from the office safe.

Thieves made off with copper pipes and brass fittings from a Northridge middle school. Repair crews assembled temporary lines to restore drinking water and toilets at Noble Middle School. School officials believe the theft took place between Saturday and Monday morning. Items stolen were a combination of copper and brass pipe and fittings.

Someone - probably with a fuel tanker truck at their disposal - drove off with 4,000 gallons of stolen diesel fuel from a gas station, police reported Monday. The gas was stolen during the early morning hours on Friday when the Exxon gas station at 2417 N. San Fernando Road was closed, said Lt. Armen Dermenjian of the Burbank Police Department. "Due to the quantity of the fuel stolen, we believe a fuel tanker truck as used," Dermenjian said. Anyone with information about the gas heist was asked to call (818) 238- 3210.
Three suspects entered a business and stole property. The suspects also inquired at a nearby medical testing lab about employment opportunities.

A Metrolink passenger train and a Southern Pacific train collided head on at the above location. The National Transportation Board is conducting the investigation to discover the cause of the collision.

Suspect involved in an attempted rape of his wife. Officers responded to suspect’s residence in response to a radio call. Suspect refused to exit residence and speak with officers. Officers were informed there was a shotgun and handgun within the residence. Ultimately after repeated requests Suspect reluctantly exited the location and refused to comply with officers’ commands. A non-categorical use of force occurred involving the use of the beanbag and bodily force.
While paramedics were away from their Los Angeles Fire Department Rescue Ambulance, treating a patient, an unknown suspect(s) scratched "PJ13" into the side of the vehicle.
properties.address: Pala Avenue and Van Nuys Boulevard

properties.synopsis: Officers discovered unknown suspect(s) had scratched two Xs into the paint of the front and rear passenger doors of the police vehicle. Officers did not see any suspect(s) and were not sure when it occurred. Officers had conducted a vehicle inspection prior to their start of watch and did not observe any damage.
Someone spray painted "187 LAPD" on the walls of a location. No suspects were seen.
A bus bench with an advertisement for a Jewish web site had the Star of David crossed out and the words "Synagogue of Satan." Unknown when defacing occurred but reported on this date.
Unknown suspect(s) marked church property with anti-Christian slogans and images.
